data.formatted_address: Ben Thanh, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
data.name: Independence Palace

reviews.text:
Not a huge amount of information in any language to be honest. But if you are a fan of mid C20th concrete, this place is for you. Be sure to explore all the little rooms, corridors and staircases. A quick walk around is one hour, a concrete fan will be here for 3 hours +.
A guide is useful for those wanting more info. Restaurants by the exit gate are pretty good, would recommend, normal prices and decent food.

It's a must visit if you're in Saigon. I definitely recommend visiting this historic place, this imposing palace with modern architecture is well preserved. The bunker in the basement is quite unique and impressive. A quite enjoyable experience exploring the museum inside and out. So many things to see as you can easily spend a good 2-3 hours taking pictures and reading all the information available to visitors. It's always packed, so come early if you can.

Independence Palace in Ho Chi Minh City is a fascinating spot! The retro 1960s architecture and historic rooms make it feel like a time capsule. The grounds are lovely to walk around, and the guided tours are super informative. Definitely worth a visit if you’re into history or just want to see a cool piece of Vietnam’s past.

An actual snapshot of the 60's .
This building is a little gem stuffed in communist Vietnam.. and the history of the building is very rich and deep.. every floor and room has actual meaning and importance to our modern day architecture... A sensational display of 60-75 Vietnam... Absolutely beautiful

A must place visit in Saigon especially for those who like history and want to know more about ho chi Minh political administration. Here is the place where you can get the answer to your question. Starting from the early days, during the Vietnam war until the modern time.

A ticket is required upon entrance costing 45000 & 60000 dong but I can't really tell the differences between these 2 prices. For me it is just the same as what you pay and what you can get. Some also might find this place boring due to different kinds of interest and some also will find this place as a photography spot as many nice angles and decorations are installed here.

The palace is clean and well maintained and there are up to 8 levels plus the underground bunker so it will take average around 2 hours to finish touring. Other than that, there are also stalls that sell food, vending machines to buy drinks and souvenirs shop for those who want to buy something here as a gift. Price he is fixed and some items you cannot find elsewhere except here. Overall it's a good visit.

data.formatted_address: Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
data.name: Ho Chi Minh City

data.formatted_address: Phú Hiệp, Củ Chi, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
data.name: Cu Chi Tunnel

reviews.text: Cu Chi Tunnels in Vietnam offer a fascinating glimpse into the country's history and resilience. These intricate underground passages served as a crucial lifeline during the Vietnam War, showcasing the resourcefulness and determination of the Vietnamese people. Exploring the tunnels gives a profound insight into the hardships endured and the innovative guerrilla tactics employed. It's a sobering yet enlightening experience, providing a deeper understanding of Vietnam's past. Visiting Cu Chi Tunnels is a must for history enthusiasts and anyone interested in Vietnam's rich cultural heritage.

Visiting the tunnels in Cu Chi is a must if you are in Ho Chi Minh City (Saigon)! It highlights the resilience and ingenuity of the Vietnamese people during the war and provides insight into how they lived under the ground for so many years. Getting to actually go into the tunnels is an incredible experience. The entrances are so well hidden and the tunnels narrow, even after they’ve been widened for tourists. I thoroughly enjoyed it and it was the second time I’ve been. Highly recommend taking the time to visit.

There is a lot to see and take in at the Cu Chi Tunnel’s. The guide was very informative and great sense of humor. War is always such a sad event and wish we could all learn from the mistakes of the past.

The bus left from District 1 at 8.15am and we returned at 1.30pm.

If your game you can have a shot at many different guns : AK47, M16, M60 to name a few. The M60 was a lot of fun however beware the bullets don’t come cheap.

The Cu Chi Tunnels are a must-visit during your trip to Ho Chi Minh City for an insightful glimpse into Vietnamese history and the resourcefulness of the Viet Cong. The experience provides a deeper understanding of the Vietnam War and its impact on the region.

Since the tunnels are far from the city center, taking a cab or riding a bike can be time-consuming and tiring. A group tour is recommended. This way, you have a tour guide to explain the history of the place, and you get to meet new people on the tour.

Worth it. We went with VIP tours in a 12 seat van . With Sunny the tour guide.
Tour was informative and gives you an appreciation  of the hardships the Vietnamese endured to fight against their enemy of the western occupation the the country could remain unified.
Lunch was awesome. The tunnels are tiny but you can try the 5m tunnel to the longer tunnels.
Was awesome.

data.formatted_address: 287, 70 Nguyễn Đình Chiểu, Phường 5, Quận 3, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam
data.name: Secret weapon bunker in Saigon

reviews.text:
I planned to visit this Secret weapon bunker in Saigon on my first day, but it was too bad because of some delays, so I couldn't make it. So on my last day in Ho Chi Minh City, I'm here for it. If you are not a customer for this place, you have to pay for a ticket to see their historical building, if you spend on something, you get free entrance. I had the pork chop + egg with rice, the taste was great. After that I headed to the historical building, I wasn't able to get into the tunnel since it was full of tourists, but nevermind, I could understand everyone is here to see this.
I would definitely visit here again if I have the chance!
Super interesting, although it's free we were ushered in to buy a coffee but it was very cheap and good coffee. The bunker shuts between 11.30 and 1 so we had to come back later but it was super cool

Interesting place to catch a small piece of local history.
Just went there. No ticket needed, no entrance fee.
This place is incredible, the bunkers are amazing. Must visit

This is a great place to go and learn about the Vietnamese history 1968 TET offensive!
It is a very hidden gem, even google takes you to the wrong place so we wish you good luck finding it!
Also the cafe next door has some hidden secrets!

data.formatted_address: 120 Song Hành Xa Lộ Hà Nội, Phường Tân Phú, Thủ Đức, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam
data.name: Suoi Tien Theme Park

reviews.text: The best thing about this place is that the employees are friendly and helpful. After you pay for your ticket many other places inside the park require an additional ticket to enter. I bought the most expensive ticket for 430,000 and it was a waste. The Magic Castle is a low end haunted house with a Harry Potter theme. The place is so dark and the quality is lacking. The Turbo Ride cinema is even worse. My seat moved to a 45 degree angle a few minutes into the show and would not move back. The 3D glasses were covered with something that made the viewing spotty. 10 minutes into the movie I got up and left. I was the only one in the theatre. At this point I just decided to walk around the park and take pictures. If you decide to go just buy the basic entrance ticket. I did not have admission to the water park so I can't share any comments about that section.

This place is wild! Would recommend mainly for adults as attractions could be quite scary for kids. We went on a Saturday in December and it was nearly empty. Nobody spoke English so we just decided to try to each attraction with no idea what to expect and it made it all the better! There were not great lunch options but otherwise perfect day!
Wonderful park with its own culture. Clean. Good service . Some rides are outdated or just simply interesting. The water park additional is great as well

I’ve never been a fan of places where you pay to enter and then pay for each ride or activity, which is how this park operates.

The water area is relatively large but more suitable for kids rather than adults. They also have bathing suits to rent for adults which seems a bit unhygienic. I didn’t have a chance to ride many rides but they overall feel of the rides is similar to a fair in America not necessarily a theme park.
The farm area is an interesting idea, you can pick fruits and see sheep. However it’s super hot outside for sheep which have thick fur for cold climates… they also have information about all the plants but it’s only in Vietnamese. I think for foreigners it’s not really worth the trip.

A bit interesting about this place. I went on an off season so not 100% sure it’s like this all the time.
The ticket is quite expensive. We just want to go to the water park but that doesn’t seem to be option at the time.
WARNING: you still have to pay for almost EVERY attraction inside the park.
The water park is great but quiet small.
It has lots of attractions/rides, maybe too many. It was dead quiet when I was there. Most of the attractions/rides were closed. The train wasn’t even running. Significant discount should be given to guests in those cases. The electric tuk tuk drop us at the end of the park and whiz away. No tuk tuk stops of any sort around the park and no regular tuk tuk run either.
For western visitors: this is more like a carnival 🎡 park than a theme park unlike Disney or Universal.

Something could be improve:
- Fix your website please, it still has default random text on the front page.
- Have tuk tuk regularly run around the park picking up customers to the next attractions. The heat is quite unforgiving. People run out of energy = less time and money spend on attractions.
- Should have a separate ticket just for water park. When I was there, everything was dead quiet except the water park.
- Reduce number of attractions and spend money to decorate / up maintenance on the rest.
- Sales for quiet time. If you don’t have most of the ride open, you should not charge even close to 50% of the ticket price.

data.formatted_address: 3 Hòa Bình, Phường 3, Quận 11, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam
data.name: Dam Sen Water Park

reviews.text: We had the pleasure of visiting this fun waterpark for kids on a Friday afternoon in  July. My kids are 6-9 and they really enjoyed the tidal wave pool and kiddie pool. There's a lazy river, too, but requires adult to go with. Overall, the kids had a blast and there are chairs everywhere to sit and get some shade even on a busy weekend. You can bring your own water and food if you want, since they don't check.
We went on a weekend so it was very crowded. The park is not extremely clean. The slides and rides are fun, and the lines were surprisingly quick. I would recommend going on a weekday.

My recent visit to Dam Sen Water Park was a delightful experience overall, marked by a clean environment, professional staff, and enjoyable rides. However, there were some concerns, particularly regarding the counter at the entrance, which marred an otherwise fantastic day.

**Cleanliness and Professionalism:** The water park boasts a commendable level of cleanliness and maintenance. The staff members are highly professional, courteous, and attentive, ensuring a pleasant and safe environment for all visitors. The rides are well-maintained, and the water quality is pristine, contributing to an enjoyable experience.

**Value and Attractions:** The variety of rides offered at Dam Sen Water Park is commendable, providing a good mix of thrills and relaxation. The presence of adequate safety guards ensures a sense of security, allowing visitors to enjoy the attractions with peace of mind. While it might not be the largest water park, it offers a welcomed escape from the hustle and bustle of Ho Chi Minh City.

**Concerns at the Entrance Counter:** However, a major downside surfaced at the entrance counter, where phone covers and floats are sold. The exorbitant pricing of $20 for a phone cover, coupled with the staff's attempt to push unnecessary purchases by stating that each cover accommodates only one phone, appears exploitative, especially towards foreigners. This practice of trying to extract more money from visitors by enforcing unnecessary purchases significantly detracted from an otherwise enjoyable experience.

**Final Thoughts:** Despite the regrettable encounter at the entrance counter, Dam Sen Water Park remains a decent option for a day of relaxation and fun in Ho Chi Minh City. The park's cleanliness, well-maintained rides, and attentive staff contribute to an overall positive experience. However, potential visitors should be cautious and aware of possible tactics aimed at extracting additional money.

In summary, Dam Sen Water Park offers an enjoyable getaway from the city's hustle and bustle, featuring well-maintained rides and a clean environment. Nonetheless, the exploitative practices at the entrance counter regarding the sale of phone covers and floats merit attention and consideration before planning a visit.

Such a fun waterpark! My friend and I went on all the slides and spent most of our time in the wave pool and lazy River. We LOVED the lazy River! The only reason I don’t give this review 5 stars is because the lockers are for only one time use. So when my friend and I went to grab our wallets for lunch we had to take all of our stuff with us and find a chair to put them on because we didn’t want to pay for another locker. But otherwise we had so much fun!!

The place was understandably busy for a Saturday, which is to be expected. The price is very reasonable. However, one significant issue I encountered was the behavior of some adults in the kids' pool area. I witnessed fathers smoking in the pool, and one father even put his cigarette out in the pool and left it there. This is unacceptable and highly inappropriate, especially in a children's area. I hope the management takes action to address this issue.
Regarding food and drinks, I recommend packing your own if you plan to stay for the whole day.
The venue accepts Visa for payment at the ticket booth. For ticket pricing, kids below 1.3 meters are charged at a lower rate, while those above 1.4 meters are charged at the adult rate. Additionally, kids below 1.3 meters are not allowed on the big slides.Overall, while the price and payment options are convenient, the management needs to enforce better rules regarding smoking in the kids' area to ensure a safe and clean environment for everyone.

reviews.text:
Place is quiet and not crowded eventhough we were there on a weekend, Saturday. The only downside is that some of the activities my kids can’t do as the employees there don’t speak English, so that was a challenge. They just said “sorry, I no English. Cannot.”

Overall, a good place to be for the kids to enjoy themselves and try the different “occupation”. It’s very very similar to Kidszania.

Great hangout place for kids. They learn how to be a police, pilot, firefighter, engineer, car designer, model, and much more in this place, with FUN. Currency system is in place. Kids get to make money from the activities and spend money for the fun they want to enjoy. It's very easy to spend the whole morning or afternoon in this place. Recommend this place to parents out there. The staff at the entrance seems not familiar with the entrance process though.

In the center, it's hard to find another place like this. There are many games that let kids play roles in different careers.
There are only two weaknesses:
- Toilets are usually not checked. Kids can easily get dirty in this place
- Foods are a failure. There are only two restaurants, and cafes are expensive, low quality.

Amazing and fun place for the kids. A whole mini world of things to learn and explore.
The kids left this place full of new experiences.
The staff is extremely friendly and good with kids, and they explain everything in English too.
Our kids has English as a second language so their English isn’t perfect. But they had lots of fun and managed to learn many new things.
Planning your visit, make sure you have enough time for your kids to enjoy this huge place. We stayed for 4 hours and didn’t even try half of the activities, and it was a really calm day with only a handful of visitors. Usually this place is filled with up to a thousand of excited kids and their parents.

Too loud for kids it would be harmful for their hearing capability. Instrument they use as if it were for a concert. Asked them to reduce the volume and none take it seriously. Ambulance fire truck etc are all exaggerately noisy. The place is not well maintained and ticket are expensive 280k for each baby with nothing much to enjoy. Bar are dirty table are not clean whilst waiter are just sit and use mobile. Dont they think paying for quality people higher and have them work properly isnt better than having many and do nothing at all.

At many places personel just wore their shoes but request kids to take it oft and by the way no one should drive with barefoot..If it to make it as reality then make it correct.

data.formatted_address: The Global City, Đỗ Xuân Hợp, An Phú, Thủ Đức, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam
data.name: City Park - The Global City

reviews.text:
Incredibly well-invested and stunning stage! Before heading to the stage, we went through the entrance of City Park for check-in. The park area offers numerous food trucks with a variety of food options for everyone to easily choose from.

What impressed me the most was the go-kart racetrack. The quality of the karts is impressive, providing a sense of safety even when racing at high speeds or drifting around corners. What surprised me the most is that despite being in Vietnam, this is the longest racetrack in Southeast Asia. Speed enthusiasts cannot miss out on this experience.

If you love sport, it is a good place to rent hourly. 👍👍👍However they do not have playground nor activities as much as other parks like Dam Sen or Suoi Tien if not for car racing tracks.
When we got there we had to wait for 90 minutes for our turn if we wanted to play.
So if you are with the group then  make reservation in advance (at least that was what they told ud)
PS: bring extra water and food since they do not have options in case if you are thirsty or hungry😉

Absolute great time!
Definitely worth returning, especially with family and friends.

I’ve been there 3 times since the opening and after a few adjustments from the early days, the operation start to run nicely.
Great welcome from the staff and managers!

The 2 tracks (indoor and outdoor) are absolutely fantastic and the timing system is great. You can check all your lap time online, compare with other drivers and improve session after session.

My kids (5 and 10 years old) are loving it as well! Different karts and speed levels (electronic speed control) are available based on the driver size and proficiency.

Quick advice: If you have some karting experience, don’t forget to bring your car driving license with you to jump to the advanced level directly and avoid running on the beginner speed for your first session.

Cool to finally have an outdoor place to hang out with family and friends for A DAY, flying a kite, live music, food trucks, go kart, VR, sport activities, jumping and climbing outdoor facilities, all under 1 clean well organized area.  It is an amazing feeling to see kids running around in a clean/safe/outdoor environment. We went with a few families over the weekend, each kid has 200k card topup, they were able to play bumping car, VR, merry go around, free outdoor games etc, gone for like 3 hours! The grass is clean,  we just sat on the grass eat and chat, looking at the LED kites. Live music was totally out of expectation. Sport facilities are well setup, indoor basketball court with Airconditioning. Outdoor tennis/basketball/football are nicely setup as well. Go kart WAS FUN!!!!
Reivew for Go Kart. Fast fun race circuit. Good cars and professional service. Ticket ar 350k/session before 5pm weekday; 450k/session after 5pm weekday. Highly recommended.

data.formatted_address: Ben Thanh, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
data.name: Tao Dan Park

reviews.text: First, pleased to see our father of nation Gandi monument 🇮🇳🫰🏻 nice atmosphere suitable for nature lovers. The wide spectrum of long trees is unusually long. I spend time in the morning and feel joyful and relaxed. If you have the time, watch a destination that is not a must-see. Kids are playing in a separate area. 6 kilometres from the airport. A paid rest room is available. Free drinking water is accessible about 50 meters from the lavatory. You can sit for 40 minutes and relax.

A tranquil, well-maintained grassy park amidst the noisy traffic. Some beautiful features and displays like the ponds, the Hung shrine, the mini Cham temple, the rockery, the playground and gym area. The tall trees are magnificent. I wish it was a bigger green area in Saigon.

A beautiful, vast, green park with massive trees and gorgeous ponds. Saw so many beautiful birds here, plus a ground squirrel! Plenty of fountains and places to sit too. Would highly recommend going if you need a touch of nature in your trip.

A lovely green space away from the hustle, bustle and noise of the busy Ho Chi Minh Streets. The park is large and expansive and features green spaces, shady trees as well as many benches to sit on to enjoy the open area.
I brought lunch from a nearby banh mi store to enjoy in the park. The park was surprisingly quiet at midday.

As soon as you step foot into this lush green space, you're transported away from the hustle and bustle of the city. The park boasts beautiful gardens, pond, kids playground, outdoor exercise machines and plenty of shaded areas to relax and unwind.

Whether you're looking to enjoy a leisurely stroll, practice Tai Chi, or simply soak up some sunshine, Tao Dan Park has something for everyone. The park is well-maintained and clean, making it the perfect escape from the chaos of urban life.
It's a peaceful oasis where you can recharge and connect with nature amidst the vibrant energy of the city.

data.formatted_address: Phường 6, Quận 3, Hồ Chí Minh 700000, Vietnam
data.name: War Remnants Museum

reviews.text: There are captured U.S. airplanes, helicopters, tanks and canons on the outside grounds. I never imagined the Chinook twin-rotors helicopter to be so huge!! Inside, are mostly photographic records of the atrocities committed by US troops and the use of chemical agents (orange, Purple etc) and the continued effects of these chemicals on the people, even decades following the war. Deformed births and skin ailments of the people create a very sad and tragic story. There are also exhibits of bullies and cubs used during the war. Be prepared for a highly emotional visit. Ticket less than US$2.

The War Remnants Museum was one of the best tourist spots we visited in Saigon.

The museum shows you the history of the Vietnam war with photos and displays. It tells you about different battles and important points during the war.

There is a souvenir shop on the ground floor.

Well maintained. Most of the rooms have ACs which was good since it was hot and humid outside when we visited.

This museum showcases such utter devastation and destruction that even people who are not fond of history subjects would be haunted forever by how the Vietnamese suffered from the Americans. It is so sad and horrifying to see the effects of Agent Orange even after several generations thereafter.

Very good.
For those who don't know much about the history or even for those who know a lot there is plenty to see here.
Different areas with different themes it was also interesting to read the political history about the support Vietnam received from other communist countries.
Very heart breaking even if you know about this war and what was done to the Vietnamese people.

It’s a must-go place for anyone who visits Vietnam. Reading its history on the book and seeing how they present it in the museum is very different. And seeing things from their angels. I personally like the presenting idea of projecting the animation of the prisoners on the floor to show what they have been through in the tiger cages. I’m glad I made it here.

data.formatted_address: 583/3 Đ. Tân Kỳ Tân Quý, Tân Quý, Tân Phú, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam

data.formatted_address: 2 Đ. Nguyễn Bỉnh Khiêm, Bến Nghé, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh 700000, Vietnam
data.name: Saigon Zoo and Botanical Garden

reviews.text: Saigon zoo is one of my most favorite healing place everytimes I get stressed. With the facility upgrade, I see the living condition of the animals has improved too. I hope they will keep the zoo so kids will always have a place that resembles nature to go to in this concrete city.

If you love animals, don't come here. The Tigers are placed in small areas with no water. The otters are squeezed together in tiny pools full of algae and trash. The turtles have zero to no water. They squeezed four adult elephants in an extremely small area that all they can do is stand in place. The birds have nothing but a dead tree and a patch of grass. I've never seen such depressed animals.

Yes, that's decaying fish in the turtle enclosure.

Don't get me started with the hippos...

People are constantly throwing trash and human food into their enclosures. I saw a goat walking around with a broken leg. Don't support this zoo.

They placed about 15-20 pelicans in a small enclosure with no plants around. The only 'happy' animals I saw were the monkeys. But they escaped their enclosures and were swinging around the zoo. Good for them I guess.

All in all, every animal was squeezed into a tiny enclosure with dirty green trash filled puddles of water.

Quite a variety of animals, but the place is pretty huge is be prepared to walk a lot. Come early to avoid the heat and, more importantly, when the animals aren't taking their afternoon nap lol...
The botanic garden is small but hosts quite a colourful array of flowers and is still worth a visit since it's already part of the zoo.

A good outing to feel close to nature. Animals are in good health , almost nature like habitats. The map needs to be followed to cover the entire zoo. Or you may be lost.
Need minimum 3 -5 hours to nicely cover the flora and fauna exhibits. Keep a water bottle handy.

Saigon Zoo and Botanical Garden is a zoo located at the city center of Ho Chi Minh. Many reviews said there are plenty of rats but i dont see any during the morning when i visited. Some of the animals are freely roam, such as peacock, birds and some monkey. Usually crowded late in the morning from school expedition and etc. great place to hang around when you are at ho chi minh and if you want to know more about the animals. There is also a mini theme park in the zoo.

data.formatted_address: Đ. Tôn Đức Thắng, Bến Nghé, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam
data.name: Công viên bờ sông (thám tử Hạnh Phúc)

reviews.text:
Amazing vibe, just next to the main road, this place becomes more lively after the evenings.
It is peaceful and calming, a lot of locals do visit the place often, sut and hang out.

The lovely views of the river under the skyline of Saigon is site to behold

great views and relaxing at night fot a walk or drink juice... This place is the best in the center to relax and walk, feeling in a metropolis... The local government looks like offering nice shows frequently for free...

Nice park. Lots of flowers and benches to sit.
Plenty of coffee shops and restos in and nearby.
The area is usually packed with people in the afternoon.
Best place to watch sunset.

Had our new Year's Eve here and it was an amazing 15 minutes spectacular fireworks display.
The whole  area was packed.

Located along the Sai Gon River, Bach Dang Wharf Park has established itself as a renowned gathering spot, particularly during weekends and holidays, due to its captivating and accessible setting.

This expansive park caters to a diverse audience, offering ample space for relaxation and entertainment, appealing to children, youngsters, and families alike.

Nestled in the city center, the park enjoys proximity to various contemporary architectural marvels and iconic landmarks. These include the People’s Committee headquarters of Ho Chi Minh City, the Nguyen Hue pedestrian mall, Nha Rong Wharf, the Thu Ngu flagpole, the Thu Thiem urban area, the Landmark 81 skyscraper, and the Bitexco building, among others.
River side park, best place to run or walking in the morning. But it’s a little bit hard to cross the street, too many vehicles with high speed

data.formatted_address: Phạm Ngũ Lão, Phường Phạm Ngũ Lão, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam
data.name: September 23rd Park

reviews.text:
We visited the park on September 23rd, hoping to find the playground shown in pictures.

Unfortunately, there was no playground. The exercise equipment was quite old, but I guess it’s better than nothing, right?

Beware, though, we spotted quite a few mice around. Not recommended for children to play here.

However, if your kids need a place to run around, this might still help 😂.

Despite that, we still managed to have a good time!

Review by Khoi,  Mon 13/11/2023
This has always been my favorite place to workout, get new friends, talk with foreigners for 8 years. I take pride in helping hundreds of people who want to visit Vietnam, starting from this park.

For tourists, this is the place where you meet your new friendly locals. Their English is terrible, like me in the first few hundred conversations. They enjoy touching your hair, being curious with your skin color. They only know the words "black" and "white", because you're unique to us Vietnamese. I love this place so much because the root of my English stems from talking with you guys. Same goes for other locals 😊

For the locals, this is where you meet great people. Those who workout value their body, so most likely they're the most wholesome people you've ever met. This is me speaking from experience.
This park have attracts everyone durimg the Tet Holidays. Decorated with beautiful colorful flowers and plants. Venders there selling in high price but don’t forget to bargain.
Cool place, I saw a squirrel eating. Young and old exercise, there is even a group of middle aged ladies singing karaoke. A lot of activities going on. A fun and cool place to just sit and watch.
It's an oxygen factory in the heart of Ho Chi Minh city and the place of joy for old citizens. The neighborhoods come here for physical activities early in the morning everyday. It's a lovely place.

data.formatted_address: 110 Đ. Nguyễn Huệ, Bến Nghé, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam
data.name: Ho Chi Minh Statue

reviews.text: A statue to commemorate Ho Chi Minh as national hero. You may come here to pay a respect or even just take a photoshoot. This statue is surrounded by high end shopping mall and hotel, city park, as well as government offices. Tourists make a visit here as there are a lot of beautiful photospots nearby. Reaching this site is not so troublesome as it is located nearby within walking distance to major landmarks in the city, or else taking a cab or e-hailing service is a good option. In the near future, with the opening of the metro line, by alighting at Opera House station, visitors may make a visit here.

🏛️ As I stood before the majestic Ho Chi Minh Statue, I couldn't help but feel a sense of awe and reverence. While I'll rate it 4 stars, my experience was deeply personal. The statue's imposing presence evoked a profound admiration for the man it represents and the history he shaped. Though the surrounding area could use a bit of sprucing up, the significance of this monument to Vietnam's beloved leader cannot be overstated. A must-visit for anyone seeking to connect with the country's rich cultural and political heritage.

The statue of the former President, Ho Chi Minh, is located right at the heart of bustling Nguyen Hue street. The square is surrounded by greenery and comes alive in the evenings with families, street vendors, living statue performers and tourists who come to take in the sights. A visit to Ho Chi Minh City would be incomplete without a stop at this scenic attraction.

Behind the statue stands the imposing City Hall. The Opera House is also nearby. Surrounding the square are luxury stores from brands like Chanel, Rolex, Balenciaga, Burberry to name a few.

Located in front of the french colonial built structur right at the heart of bustling, traffic-filled Ho Chi Minh, Nguyen Hue street. It is a symbol of love from the Vietnamese people for president Ho Chi Minh. It is surrounded by greenery and a couple of pretty benches, becomes alive with soft lights and musicians in the evening, and scenic attraction ideal for unwinding after a long day.
Wow what an awsome dragon in the middle of the city, but they do disassemble it some months of the year so your timing matters

data.formatted_address: VRMF+GV9, Đường 16, Long Bình, Quận 9, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam
data.name: History Ethnic & Cultural Park

reviews.text:
Only a few people knows about this wonderful place.    This somewhat huge complex includes a Hung King memorial (which you can get to by following a flight of stairs and walkways).

Silent and solemn.  A must visit for Saigon residents.

PRO TIP:   The place is quite far from tge city center so an arranged transportation is recommended.
This park consisted of two areas. Hung King memorial place and curvature monuments area. Approaching road of Hung King memorial is very beautiful, one of most beautiful place in HCM.
Nice place but I don't know whether I went at wrong time or its always closed.

Nice place to organize a race contest, possible to hide a lot of course and to challenge teams. BBQ possible also, toilets and place to protect from the rain nice.
I just missed English historical explaination ~
nice view

data.formatted_address: QMQV+6GM, Phường Võ Thị Sáu, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City 700000, Vietnam
data.name: Le Van Tam Park

reviews.text:
Le Van Tam Park, located in District 1 of Ho Chi Minh City, offers a pleasant green space amidst the bustling urban landscape. The park's centerpiece is a statue of Le Van Tam, a Vietnamese hero from the Indochina War. Interestingly, the park was formerly the site of a prestigious French colonial cemetery, adding a layer of historical significance to the area.

Today, it's a popular spot for families to enjoy outdoor recreation, with walking paths, a fountain, and an entertainment area for children. Visitors can observe locals engaging in various activities such as badminton, ballroom dancing, and aerobics.

While not a major tourist attraction, Le Van Tam Park provides a nice respite from the city's hectic pace. It's an ideal place to relax, have a picnic, or simply enjoy some fresh air in the heart of Saigon. The park's large shady trees and green spaces make it a welcome retreat for both locals and tourists seeking a moment of tranquility.

I was taking a leisurely stroll through this park, trying to escape the hustle & bustle of Tan Dinh Market. It was one of those perfectly balmy afternoons when the park was bustling with activity. Kids were playing, joggers were doing their thing, and vendors were selling everything from ice cream to those bizarrely addictive fried sweet potato balls.

I decided to take a break and grab a cold drink from one of the vendors. As I’m sipping on my iced tea, I notice this elderly gentleman sitting on a park bench, intently watching a group of young people practicing Tai Chi. Now, I’ve seen Tai Chi before, but this guy? He’s completely mimicking their moves with this incredibly serious look on his face, like he’s determined to become the grandmaster of Tai Chi by the end of the session.

I couldn’t help but chuckle, and so did a few passersby. Eventually, the Tai Chi group noticed and invited him to join in. The gentleman, with a big grin, happily obliged. What followed was a hilarious display of synchronized Tai Chi—well, sort of. It was less about perfect form and more about everyone having a good laugh together.

It was a moment of pure joy and camaraderie that summed up the spirit of this place: a place where people come together, relax, and share a bit of happiness.

Visited during Banh Mi (Bread) Yearly Festival on 19th May 2024. Many stores are selling various kind of breads, drinks and souvenirs during weekend festival from 17-19 May. Many local and foreign visitors are enjoying the food.
So nice place. I like parks which there are so many trees and grass. Many people are sitting on the grass for enjoying. I just take the travel bus to pass by

One of the beautiful and spacious park in Ho Chi Minh City. It is a good place to enjoy the greeneries and fresh air in the city. It is a also a good place to having exercise like jogging or playing at the playground. There are some seats available at the park. Public toilet is also available here.

data.formatted_address: District 1, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam

data.formatted_address: Đ. Nguyễn Văn Bình, Bến Nghé, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam
data.name: Ho Chi Minh City Book Street

reviews.text: absolutely lovely place. i always visit the Book Street whenever i’m back in the city. such a sight to see & to simply bask in the atmosphere.

It’s a nice busy buzzing street where you have various book stores and cafés. It’s barely 5 minutes walk from the Saigon postal office. There is a highlands coffee nearby. The book stores have mostly books in Vietnamese language. But u walk around , check out stalls and cafés. There’s a piano too on which you can walk and enjoy. It’s quite well decorated. There are chairs placed where you can sit and read. Small street. No entry ticket

Not a long street but a very cute and cozy street, filled with little book stores selling all sort of books.
Can find some nice accessories and souvenirs here also.
A best place to spend half a day for book lovers. You can sit and enjoy a cup of coffee here while watching the people near by. You might be able to find some little gifts here.

A special steet dedicated to books. How cool is that. I just loved this place.. !! I was so happy being here. But every book was in Vietnamese. I was searching for books written in Vietnamese but translated in English. Couldn't find any. But I loved that place.

data.formatted_address: Ben Thanh, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
data.name: Ben Thanh Market

reviews.text:
Ben than market is SGN city most cheaper market
The market is also quite well organized with the walkways quite wide and very easy to navigate.
The fresh produce section on the one side is definitely not for the squeamish. Avoid if you are so inclined. The market is under roof but no AC only a few fans doing their best.

It’s worth a trip, not really cheap. The stall holders are aggressive but they chilled out a bit in the evening. Go for the experience but not for the shopping

When visiting Ho Chi Minh City, Ben Thanh Market is a must-see attraction. You can find a wide variety of goods at affordable prices. However, haggling is a common practice, so be prepared for that. Personally, I visited the market more for the experience than for shopping. In the middle of the market, you'll find several old stalls where you can grab a quick meal. While the environment might not be the cleanest or coolest, it offers an authentic local experience. If you enjoy immersing yourself in local culture, I highly recommend it. The food is very cheap and quite tasty.

We had a lot of fun exploring this market and ended up buying chocolates, coffee powder and sneakers. All of them were worth it. Also the delectable food stalls inside are amazing. If you’re in Saigon, this is something you shouldn’t skip.
Some of the shop owners are a bit too aggressive if you make eye contact with merchandise for a little too long so beware otherwise no one accosts you to buy stuff and if you politely decline, you’re good.
The hygiene level was great, the food served was delectable and we had a pleasant time sampling Vietnamese cuisine and shopping of course. One can even buy branded clothes were dirt cheap prices. Also consider bargaining as the prices are never final in places like this.

"A scammed place, a tourist trap?"

You can define it yourself. Been here twice and I have a lot of experiences and mixed feelings about this market. This place has a lot of items that you can find especially if you are a tourist that is looking for souvenirs, coffee beans, and apparel. The seller here is quite aggressive in pushing you to buy at their shop but you must be more aggressive and smart to deny it. Just simply shut up, reject firmly or walk away. Avoid asking the price if you just want to know as they might push you to buy. Just let them offer the price first and if you don't like just walk away and don't bargain for more.

It happened to me bumping into this one shop owned by this sweet young lady that can speak Malay that offers me a cheaper price compared to other shops only on the first time asking without forcing me to buy from her shop. She gave me the best price and also provided me with good service and was not annoyed entertain our behaviour. For those who want to come I totally recommend you to find this lady shop to buy jersey, short, and shirt. Also don't forget to quote your best price so you can meet in the middle ground.

For those who don't want to bargain and tired of negotiating there are also a section where all the items are fixed price so you don't need to argue with the seller. Just buy it if you like and leave if you don't. I hope for those who want to visit to make a good decision in purchasing items because of interest not because of being force.

The place is a good place to buy products.
Keep in mind the following things while shopping from here:-
1. Bargain. The prices can be dropped to 80%-90% literally. (I bought a product which was quoted 350,000 dong and bought it at 50,000 dong)
2. Do try the products from many shops before buying from one shop.
3. The shop keepers are a bit rude. I found a few shopkeepers probably abusing a few white guys in their local language and laughing by pointing fingers to them.
4. Best way to bargain is to let the shop keeper give you the better price.
5. Incase some shopkeeper is rude to you, you can fill out the feedback form available at every exit gate of the market.

data.formatted_address: 07 Công trường Lam Sơn, Bến Nghé, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh 710212, Vietnam
data.name: Ho Chi Minh City Opera House

reviews.text: Going into this experience none of us were quite sure what to expect, but we were pleasantly surprised with the show! I don’t want to give any spoilers for anyone who will watch in the future, but this show is definitely suitable for all ages - my young kids enjoyed it just as much as my wife and I. The show itself travels through traditional Vietnamese culture, modern day life, and funny stories that are sure to entertain. The theatre itself is beautiful, my only struggle was the seats. When I went to sit down I fell through my seat! You might be asking how that happened…well the seats are not stable in the sense that you need to sit in a certain position as to not fall down. This seating struggle did take a couple minutes to get used to, however it really wasn’t a problem as the show went on. I could not recommend this beautiful show enough!!

Attended the AO show which was fantastic! Highly recommend. Very artistic with traditional and modern scenes. Performers are such athletes and super entertaining. Left feeling on a high.

There are three pricing tiers of seats available. Seats are very comfortable even for the plus sized bum!

The Opera House itself is architecturally beautiful. If ticketed, can arrive an hour earlier and meander around to take pics. Though, no pics or videos  allowed during the show.

visited outside only, not for performance. Beautiful fasade with heroic size female statues, nice photo point, there are ansamble of 2 fountanes on both sides, with musicians boy and girl in themiddle, on the right from te Opera house front possible can book a city tour,

Ho Chi Minh City Opera House is very beautiful. The lights at light are Ben prettier.

There is a lot happening all around the opera house so it is quite busy, We went on a city tour and had to park there.

Pretty cool place. We can only imagine that the inside is beautiful.

Plenty of restaurants and shopping all around.

For more adventures follow us on YouTube  @eyecool

We came here to watch AO Show after watching Teh Dar in Hoi An. The show is fantastic. I really enjoyed. It’s definitely ended much better than it started. There is some real talent there and I hope they are getting paid adequately, not in Vietnam standards! I really think they’d do well if someone from Cirque de Soleil discovers them, not a joke!

The only problem I had is with the opera staff. I understand that everyone must sit where that paid for as the tickets get really expensive (More expensive than West End shows!); therefore the staff is trying to keep everybody on their seats. However, the show started and while everyone is focusing on the show, they are really disrupting to warn people who moved. Yes, I am sure they have rules (I’ve worked in theatres before so I know) but just chill man! No one is coming. We’re half way into the show and they’re still walking between isles to warn people disruptively. They should clarify this before the show starts so less people would do it. It’s a shame that such a nice show is disrupted like this. I hope they do something about this in the future.

data.formatted_address: 36 Đ. Hồ Tùng Mậu, Bến Nghé, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam
data.name: Saigon Skydeck

reviews.text: Should visit during evening/sunset, the views are splendid during those times especially the lights around the city makes it much more enjoyable than during the day. Must visit attraction in ho chi Minh city

It’s a great sky deck the lift is so fast you don’t even feel it. There are 64 floors however you only go to 49. You pay for what you get there’s not much to do up there expect look around  the city and visit the áo dài museum. I would recommend going at night as the city lights are very pretty. The staff are very friendly.

We came around 5pm in the afternoon and no one was here yet. The tickets cost 240000 VND which I think is acceptable where you can have a view for unlimited time. But somehow once you enter you might feel boredom to stay here for a long time.

The ticket purchasing process was smooth and at the top level you can see the view of Saigon city from a 360 degree angle. You also can zoom to some specific place with the tower scope. If you are lucky then you're gonna see a sunset view from the top of the building. As for us it is quite unfortunate not to view that due to weather season and cloud. More and more tourists start coming as the sun is beginning to set.

All in all we still enjoyed being here. There is also a booth that sells merchandise and souvenirs of the skydeck. Free wifi is also provided on the whole level. We stayed here until around 6.30pm and I think it's a fine place to visit especially for those who want to see the view from the top and the exchange from day to night.

Was very excited to go here, elevator trip was fun, the views were amazing. However the prices were very expensive and the portion sizes were extremely small. Way over priced for us regular people. This is strictly for the rich and I didn't do my research on the menu prices.
If prices were reasonable I would of given this a 4 or 5 star. Service was good too. They quick to serve and sit us down

Really lovely view and worth going, but two things:
1) crazy AC
2) the lights are so bright, in the night view you see a lot reflections rather than great view of the night city. But under certain angles and making a shade by yourself you can make great photos) but for the money we paid we could have better experience

data.formatted_address: Đ. Bùi Viện, Phường Phạm Ngũ Lão, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam
data.name: Bui Vien Walking Street

reviews.text:
Place is lively, a lot of hustle and bustle. You need to watch the hustle.
Know what you're paying for while ordering, or else find that the few slices of cucumber gets billed on par with a main course.

On the weekends, you have a lot of cultural shows with shows playing out on street corners, with highly skilled actors and musicians busking.

Sit at one of the wayside cafes and beer bars and observe the hustling and bustling as people stream by.

**Nightlife Street**

Visiting this street during the day felt like seeing a rockstar before their morning coffee: a bit dull and not quite in character. It's like Khaosan Road in Bangkok, full of bars, massage parlors, restaurants, nightclubs, and some "funny" things you probably don't want your kids asking questions about.

During the daytime, it’s mostly closed or filled with local life, but by night, it transforms into a nightlife wonderland. Definitely not a place for family outings, unless your idea of family fun involves explaining why that one guy is juggling fire while another is dressed like Elvis.

We stuck to the daylight hours, which meant we saw it in its "I just woke up" phase. It was a bit like visiting a nightclub while it’s still getting its beauty sleep.

Imagine this: It’s a hot, humid night, and the street is packed with people from all walks of life. The neon signs are glowing, and the air is filled with the enticing smells of street food and the sound of laughter and chatter.

Suddenly, a group of street performers sets up a portable speaker and starts blasting some energetic music. Within minutes, a crowd gathers, and people start dancing right there in the middle of the street.

What started as a few curious onlookers quickly turned into a full-blown dance party, with everyone from backpackers to local vendors joining in. The impromptu event drew in more and more people, creating a lively and unforgettable scene. The atmosphere was electric, and for a few hours, strangers danced together, creating a sense of community and shared joy that epitomized the spirit of Bui Vien.

This kind of spontaneous fun is typical of this Walking Street, where the unexpected is the norm and every night holds the promise of a new adventure.

Bui Vien Walking Street is the pulsing heart of Ho Chi Minh City's nightlife😊

One of the best ways to experience Bui Vien is to grab a seat at one of the many streetside bars or cafes

This bustling thoroughfare comes alive after dark, transforming into a vibrant pedestrian zone packed with backpackers, tourists, and locals alike. The street is lined with numerous bars, pubs, and clubs, each competing for attention with neon lights and thumping music.

Street performers and dancers on elevated platforms add to the electric atmosphere. Food lovers will find plenty to enjoy, from local street vendors to international restaurants serving a variety

and watch the colorful parade .it's an essential stop for anyone looking to experience Saigon's energetic nightlife scene.

Bui Vien Walking Street in Ho Chi Minh City is a vibrant hub of activity, offering an electrifying nightlife experience. The street pulses with live music and impromptu dance performances, making it a favorite for both locals and tourists. Food stalls line the street, serving a tantalizing array of street food that captures the essence of Vietnamese cuisine. The atmosphere is perpetually lively, with crowds packing the narrow lanes, adding to the energetic vibe. Despite the hustle and bustle, Bui Vien retains its charm, providing a unique blend of cultural immersion and modern entertainment. For those seeking a lively night out, it's an unmissable destination.

data.formatted_address: Ho Chi Minh City Metropolitan Area, Vietnam
data.name: Ho Chi Minh City Metropolitan Area

data.formatted_address: Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
