data.formatted_address: 65 Lý Tự Trọng, Bến Nghé, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam
data.name: Museum of Ho Chi Minh City

reviews.text:
Its a nice place to explore about the war history. This museum and two other museums are situated in the same vicinity.
So you can cover all of them within walking distance. This museum is particularly used for wedding photo shoots as when we visited there was a photo shoot going on already. Not much to see but still a good place that you can cover in maximum 15 to 20 minutes.

(+) Excellent display of relics
(-) Almost no AC, overcrowded
A great place to admire fragments of this city’s glorious past and the wonderful architecture of the palace. A much obvious downside must be the air conditioning system or the lack thereof. However, this place is picturesque and guarantees you decent pictures. This is also the reason why I was kind of bummed out at the end of my visit since there were many couples with camera crews and they were blocking the staircase to the second floor.

Nice enough for the 30,000 VND entrance fee. I love old classic buildings in general. Tbh didnt read much about the history. No aircon tho. But place is somehow eerie and peaceful at the same time. Good to wait out the rain. Restroom surprisngly clean

Entry was 30,000VND and you pay at the corner gate. There are 2 floors to see plus the tunnels in the basement ( much cooler down there ). Quite a bit to see covering a lot of history of Vietnam. There wasn’t many people there so was easy to see all the exhibits. No air con just ceiling fabs so don’t expect it to be any cooler than outside. Some good displays outside as well - tank, helicopter, planes and canons.

This location is highly sought after for wedding photography, and it's ideal for a leisurely hour-long visit. The picturesque setting offers ample opportunities for stunning shots, making it a must-see destination.

data.formatted_address: phường Long Phước, Thủ Đức, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
data.name: Ao Dai Museum

reviews.text: 50k vnđ ticket for an adult. Good place for photo shooting. You can rent Áo Dài or buy. My recommendation is buying as a souvenir gift since the price is reasonable.
Highly reccomended. Nice collection of Ao Dai, as well as beautiful buildings for photos. You can rent the ao dai as well.

Outside the city and public transport not easy. The exhibition of Áo dài was boring but the main attraction of the place is for photo opportunities in the gardens, at the lake or in the old style buildings. Many young people having pictures taken in the áo dài that you can rent. A good place for wedding photos but a special fee! There is food and drinks available too. Enjoyed the visit but once is enough.

Very impressive museum. Here is a must-go place especially for people who are interested in traditional costumes. You can try wearing an Ao Dai and take pictures for maybe 100K or 300K(sorry I’m not sure). The traditional Vietnamese costumes showed in the museum were just so beautiful and well-designed. Strongly recommend!

Small exhibition. Pretty far from the city, about 40 mins by car. Seemed popular with local youths taking pictures in their Ao dais. I'd say visit if you have the time, have seen all other attractions in and around Ho Chi Minh City, and are really interested in the history of Ao dais.

data.formatted_address: 2 Đ. Nguyễn Bỉnh Khiêm, Bến Nghé, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam
data.name: History Museum

reviews.text:
Good collection and presentation of progression of all artifacts from the beginning  to end of the walk in tour.

Though currently some parts are under maintenance  and cant take photos of the beautiful place

the only sorrow I visited it on time of outside restavration and fixing works so no photos of outside building. It was interesting to see, how vedic culture varies from one South-Asian country to another, and gods like Laxmi, Shiva, Vishnu have little different features with preserving all main atributes (Champa exposition) , also there are many sanskrit names on the map of Vietnam, like Indrapura and so on. Not only specific Vietnam culture, but also Kambodian, Chinese, Sino-Tibetian represented there, as it has it's place on this country. Different Buddha, Bodhisattva and Idam images and statues are exposited as well, also you can enjoy tribal Vietnamese culture. Also coffee shop and souvenir shop are inside the territory of the Museum, and peaceful inner yard with ponds and bonsai trees.

This museum is conveniently located close to the Saigon Botanical Garden and Zoo, making it perfect for a quick 30-minute visit. Inside, you'll find exhibits that guide you through the history of Vietnam and Buddhism. There are also a few souvenir shops and cafes where you can unwind.

The History Museum of Ho Chi Minh City is a must-visit for anyone interested in Vietnam's rich history. Located in District 1, the museum is housed in a beautiful French colonial-style building that dates back to 1929. While not a large museum, it packs a punch with its well-curated exhibits that cover various aspects of Vietnamese history.

One of the highlights is the collection of artifacts from the Bronze Age Dong Son civilization, which emerged around 2000 BCE. The museum also features relics from the Funan, Cham, and Khmer civilizations, as well as a fine collection of Buddha statues. Visitors can also see a perfectly preserved mummy of a local woman who died in 1869.

The museum does an excellent job of illustrating the evolution of Vietnamese culture, from ancient times to the present day. The exhibits are well-labeled and informative, with good English translations. While there are no specific exhibits on the great battles of the past, the museum provides a comprehensive overview of Vietnam's history.

Overall, the History Museum of Ho Chi Minh City is a great way to learn about Vietnam's fascinating past. The beautiful colonial architecture and well-curated exhibits make it a must-see for anyone visiting the city.

A good place to learn about ancient history of Vietnam - quite some artefacts from India, China and Cambodia on display too. Several depictions of wars between Vietnam and their neighbours explains their resolve in achieving and maintaining independence. This museum is amazingly well maintained, clean and tidy! Entrance fee of V30K is a good deal!

data.formatted_address: 97 P. Đức Chính, Phường Nguyễn Thái Bình, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam
data.name: Ho Chi Minh City Museum of Fine Arts

reviews.text:
This is the official museum of modern art, the name is incorrect.

Quite a lot of interesting pieces inside, but as others already mentioned expect a lot of neglected details and no AC. The building is interesting, it's quite intriguing to explore, as nobody really tells you where to go or provide any type of maps of details.

Entrance is very inexpensive, 30.000 and there is space to park your motorbike inside.

Overall enjoyable, and a great place to spend a couple of hours, if you don't mind the heat.

Decent Museum of modern vietnamese art and some older ceramics and wood works from Vietnam.

I found some artistic highlights, but most of them are mediocre at best. You can visit it in less than an hour if you make it quick and focus on the highlights.

The buildings are from the founding era and worth a visit alone. The museum contains three different buildings, but the most noteworthy is the first, the main building.

The building themselves are old, and they have only an aircon in certain rooms. Fans are not everywhere present, but the window shades are closed, so there is some protection from the sun.

They don't offer any map for orientation in the museum. Also, there is a lack of signage, especially for orientation in the buildings.

On a side note, security seems pretty lax. Only security cameras are present in most rooms, and the staff present seems absent. That's not the best way to protect precious art.

Amazing and stunning art pieces.. To know about Vietnamese art scene and culture. There is locker for your bag storage for free. And can purchase little artwork/paintings as souvenirs from downstairs reception area.  Purchase ticket without any line.

Ok this museum has so much potential but no air conditioning kills the experience as the limited fans they have just don't cut it on hot days... And let's face it in Saigon that's every day!!!

The art work is amazing. Architecture so so. But again, so much potential. If you have a way to cool yourself down well worth a visit.

I highly recommend giving this museum a visit. The building is so beautiful and you learn a lot about the Vietnamese culture and the history of the country through art. The ticket is very cheap so definitely go check it out if you're in the city

data.formatted_address: 41 Hoàng Dư Khương, Phường 12, Quận 10, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam
data.name: Museum of Traditional Vietnamese Medicine

reviews.text: Beautiful building and heartwarming guidance. Just the perfect place to come on a rainy day. A little escape from the busy city center and an opportunity to learn about traditional medicine and Vietnam's approach to it. There are fun activities you can try like taking photos in the traditional outfits and rolling the medicines on the stones.

An interesting look into traditional Vietnamese medicines. Maybe not too interesting for those from Asian countries where such medicines are already quite common, but still worth a look if you have some time. Entrance was 180K VND which is a tad pricey compared to other attractions. Started with a 15 min video which was quite boring tbh (if you have kids with you, forget about watching this), then a short 5-10 min intro by the staff and then you're on your own.
They do have 2 washrooms on site. At the end you're offered a small cup of herbal tea. They also sold some small bottled chilled medicinal drinks for 35k VND per bottle but forget about those - they taste really artificial (what to expect for the price :) ).

Unique and magical museum, four floors of ancient tools and wisdom.
Other than medicine making tools you can find here details, paintings and samples of hundreds of herbal medicinal plants and liquers.
Everything is well explained.
Nice view from the rooftop as well.
At the entrance on the ground floor there's a shop for herbal tea and oils.
All together enjoyed our tour here.

It was better than expected! It was 6 floors high and filled with so much information. When entering, a staff brought us up while explaining to us how to navigate the place. An information booklet was passed to us so we can refer to the numbers on the wall. There’s a pleasant surprise on one of the floors and I’ll let you discover that yourself :)

We didn’t have to queue for tickets. Could enter right away
If you have an interest in medicine then this is a must visit. I didn't know that Vietnam has a very rich history when it comes to medicine. It's a private museum so it's well maintained.

data.formatted_address: 202 Đ. Võ Thị Sáu, Phường Võ Thị Sáu, Quận 3, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam
data.name: South-Vietnamese Women Museum

reviews.text: Found this museum while browsing the Saigon map. It's free entry and visitor's pass will be given by the guard. The exhibition consisted of 3 levels. L1  is a small hall displaying the ceramic arts. L2 displayed Ao Dai from the 30s to present day. And L3 showcased the strength, sacrificed and unity of the Vietnamese women during the war time. My 1 hr was  well spend.

Tucked away in District 3, just 2.6km from Ben Thanh Market, the South-Vietnamese Women Museum offers a unique and insightful experience. While not particularly large, this historical building houses a wealth of exhibits that commemorate the remarkable achievements of Vietnamese women throughout history.

The museum's highlight is its fascinating exhibition on southern women's contributions to Vietnam's political struggles, featuring over 1,000 photographs and artifacts. Another standout display showcases the evolution of Ao Dai, the traditional Vietnamese dress, with 65 items illustrating its design changes over time.

Visitors can explore exhibits on traditional clothing, accessories, jewelry, and select art pieces. The museum also offers a peaceful atmosphere, rarely crowded even on weekends. A notable recent addition was the Non Dénommé exhibition by Tanguy Sevat-Denuet, providing insight into French-Vietnamese cultural identity.

For those seeking a unique perspective on Vietnamese history and culture, this museum is highly recommended. It offers a refreshing alternative to more mainstream attractions, shedding light on the often-overlooked contributions of women to Vietnam's rich heritage.

This museum is dedicated to South Vietnamese Women Heroes is quite interesting.

The 1st floor also showcases Ao Dai women's dresses (a.k.a. Vietnam's national dress).

The upper floors shows photo tributes to to Vietnamese women heroes - mostly during thr French and American/Vietnam wars.

A must visit - only if you are staying for more than a week in Saigon.

PRO TIP:  This museum is located on Vo Thi Sau street.  And rightfully so since Vo Thi Sau is one of the greatest Vietnamese heroines!

Really thoughtful highlight of Southern Vietnamese women and their contributions to the country during times of conflict AND traditional long dresses. Two very interesting exhibitions.

Toilets are very clean. Grounds and exhibitions rooms seem to be well maintained. No high-powered AC, but fans circulate throughout.

No admission fee when I went. Idk if that is standard. I did make a small purchase at the little souvenir shop to help support the museum.
It’s pretty nice for a museum that doesn’t charge you the entrance fee.

data.formatted_address: 5 Đ. Tôn Đức Thắng, Bến Nghé, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam
data.name: Ton Duc Thang Museum

reviews.text: Quality not quantity! A relatively small museum on two floors but with well-designed exhibits about the life and times of Uncle Tôn. The “rice grinding” and Tiger cages room has audio and allows an “experiential” visit. Very well done. The explanations are clear and bilingual. The different media for the making portraits upstairs are worth examining. Note the opening hours. Entrance is free. A restaurant is also on the premises so you can have lunch during the midday closing hours. Some parking for cars and scooters is available on site.

Very interesting museum. Is not very big, so you will not be tired after visiting it. You will learn a lot of information about second president and his life. Staff is very nice, friendly and helpful. They speak good English what's very good in Vietnam. Highly recommended place to visit!

Went in late June 2023, the place is under heavy renovation or rebuilding, closed. The guards did not speak English and did not provide any info. No idea of re-open date or if at all. Gave 1 star not because it is bad (I couldn't get in) but because there's no sign or notice to inform visitors about the closure.
Good place to visit and understand the Vietnam war. The Con Dao prison exhibit is well design
Very nice and there is a vietnamese  restaurant whit very good food and heineken beer

data.formatted_address: 87 Thăng Long, Phường 4, Tân Bình, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam
data.name: Air Force Museum

reviews.text: Cost was 40,000 Vietnamese dong so good value for the experience you’re receiving. Definitely a must see for any tourist visiting the city. There’s incredible photography revealing different aspects of the war.

Dont expect google maps to get there first go. It will take you to unnamed military roads with armed soldiers at check points. Who will direct you how to get there. Entry was free, no other tourist around. No one inside to guide you but again it was free!!!! Nothing really exciting to see but same old one sided propaganda.
Run down but great to see and free. Just wanted to see the MIG21. An aircraft of the era. Small museum but something else to do especially if you’re staying close to the airport for a night.
i loved just wandering around checking out the planes. There's also a small coffee shop across the road that has fantastic coffees and the staff were amazing.

The place was free so that's a good sign. It also is pretty quiet so you can enjoy your time there. There is planes and helicopters which are absolutely amazing there but other than that not much to do. It is mainly used as a place for locals to hang out but nonetheless still a cool place to come to.

data.formatted_address: Số 2 Đ. Lê Duẩn, Bến Nghé, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam
data.name: Ho Chi Minh Campaign Museum

reviews.text: Also American-Vietnamese war remnants are there in very good state with detailed descriptions and heroic memorial.There is a big wedding hall , so we also have tradition in post-USSR countries to make wedding  photos on the war memorials and remnants like tank and airplanes, like giving gratitude and respect to price, payed for peace. Thus pace just few steps away History Museum of Vietnam and also near Zoo and Botanical garden, but for obe day it is not really enough time to visit all tgus three places in ones.

Main highlights are the weapon showcase outdoors which shows all the North Vietnamese artillery, captured aircrafts, US aircraft debris, russian trucks and tank. No AC or fan indoors and even the lights are not on. The only nice part inside was the bust of HCM and the map. Entry is free
Very disappointing musuem as compared to the others in HCMC. Its not worth to make a visit here. Entry is free. If you are paying, it is for a guidebook or brochure.

Lady at the receprion was nice,but some parts have lights and AC off. No one to assist turning it on. We couldnt find the swich. Tickets cost 10k vnd per person. The least they could do is turn AC and lights on.

Drop By this place.
Just walk in will do.
Some photo has English descriptions, some don’t.
I came to see photos and some historical thing .

Interesting

data.formatted_address: 189B/3, Nguyễn Văn Hưởng, Thảo Điền, Thủ Đức, Hồ Chí Minh 70000, Vietnam
data.name: Quang San Art Museum

reviews.text:
The Quang San Art Museum is my favorite gem in D2. The artwork on display is simply professional, showcasing the influential artists in the story of Vietnamese art history, as well as contemporary works.

The museum's exhibition spaces are exquisitely designed, with the lighting allowing the pieces to truly shine. The artwork is well-organized, with a thoughtful juxtaposition of historical and modern pieces. They also host thought-provoking exhibitions, workshops, and cultural events that engage both artists and art lovers alike.
This place is unique in Saigon, and everyone interested in art should visit it. It has a beautiful collection of Vietnamese art, in a nice building next to the river.
Very nice art collections here, love it so much
An excellent museum to learn more about Vietnamese art, its genesis, history and evolution. A massive collection that completely took me by surprise, will be back!
You have to pay to enter but worth it.

data.formatted_address: 2 Đ. Nguyễn Bỉnh Khiêm, Bến Nghé, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam
data.name: Geological Museum of Vietnam

reviews.text:
Opening time: office hours only.

Entrance fee: free.

Personal experience: the showroom is a bit small. But the number of items is quite numerous.
There weren't any tour guides but the information on display was quite ok. There are QR codes with information embedded inside. You can use any smartphone to scan and read.
You can learn quite a lot about earth history here.

There are three floors full of items. Be sure to visit not only the first floor but the second and third floor as well.

In general, it's worth visiting even if you aren't majoring in geology or archeology.
If you love rock (n not roll), this is a place. Should take notes some name of ores and fossils for researching later

Super cool place! It's interesting how geology museums everywhere all smell the same: the scholarly book smell. Also, it's free to come in and see things! Very interesting geological map of Vietnam and so many minerals to look at. Worth a visit if you're just walking around, and there's a jeweler next door that makes stuff, so stop in to see some nifty things.

Don’t be afraid of the dogs. The lady that parks the mopeds will direct you to the book to sign and the ROOM that the rocks are in.
It very old and not overly taken care of. If you have someone in your family who is into the rocks, stop and see them. It is directly next to the Zoo.
Love to be in company of crystalls and minerals.

data.formatted_address: Căn hộ A5, Block A Chung cư Lavita Garden, 17 Đ. Số 3, Trường Thọ, Thủ Đức, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam
data.name: AZ Gallery

reviews.text: New great location of AZ studio in town. Come to check out if you are in Saigon.
I love AZ Gallery 💗 It has beautiful paintings by local artists, great service and a very cool vibe.

The creative space to introduce, exhibit, exchange and sell the high-quality art works by young artists of Vietnam, and share the knowledge about art market, art collection and art appreciation to target audience.
Good place to enjoy pieces of daily life in the eye of art!
An absolutely wonderful space. When I came here I didn't want to leave because there were so many beautiful paintings. It feels like being immersed in art. I really like it!

data.formatted_address: 6/15 Đ. Cách Mạng Tháng 8, Phường Bến Thành, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh 700000, Vietnam
data.name: Drink Vietnam

reviews.text:
If I were staying in Saigon longer, I would be visiting this place everyday for their delicious food and tea!

We stumbled upon this place by accident but what a lovely find. Very friendly staff. Yummy and very affordable food. The fresh tea blends are divine.. I ended up buying a pack to bring home.

I will definitely return one day and would highly recommend to friends to visit.

Love it!
This place is a gift

Very comfortable environment tucked away in a little alley off a very popular area. The tea is delicious and they have many different selections of tea and coffee. They have Wi-Fi and I saw someone else working there on his computer. Also, they have a table with a little fish tank under it as you can see pictured.
Such a chill place in HCMC for some tea. Love the ambiance and decorations, plus the aquarium under the table. Tea is excellent as well.
a quirky little hole in the wall place for coffee! came in here to hide from the heat and was thoroughly rewarded with a great cup of coffee. try the house blend!

data.formatted_address: 720A Đ. Điện Biên Phủ, Vinhomes Tân Cảng, Bình Thạnh, Hồ Chí Minh 72300, Vietnam
data.name: Landmark 81

reviews.text: This building, Landmark 81, is amazing. We got there early and purchased our tickets. The consisted of our entrance fee, 2 large photos, and 2 coffees on the 79th floor. The view from the 81st floor is spectacular. We were allowed to walk outside with a harness attached to the building. It's an eerie experience,  but it's worth doing. I would highly recommend going up for a couple of hours. We then headed down to the ground floor where you can enjoy some shopping or something to eat in the many cafes. We chose Taste of Saigon on the outside of the building. Everything was quite inexpensive, considering what we pay back home in Australia.

Landmark 81, the tallest building in Vietnam, offers an unparalleled vantage point to witness the stunning sunrise and sunset over Ho Chi Minh City. This architectural marvel provides breathtaking panoramic views that capture the essence of the city's dynamic skyline. Visitors can enjoy a perfect blend of modernity and natural beauty, making it an ideal destination for both locals and tourists. Whether you're looking to start your day with a spectacular sunrise or unwind with a serene sunset, Landmark 81 delivers an unforgettable experience that showcases the best of Ho Chi Minh City.

Landmark 81 is the tallest building in Vietnam, the second tallest building in Southeast Asia and the 17th tallest building in the world. It’s an impressive building from a far and even more from the top. The cost for the standard ticket was 500,000d or you can get one for 540,000d with the bundled AR game at the top. There are 3 levels you can view from 79,80 and 81. I would allow at least 1/2hr to 3/4 of an hour to take in the stunning views from just under 400m. You wont realize how big Ho Chi Minh City is until you view it from up there. The city is as far as the eye can see.

This has to be a must for anyone who wants to experience this when you come to Ho Chi Minh City.

To learn more check out the link below :

https://youtu.be/zM986_Fym1Q

My partner and I stayed at the Landmark hotel this past weekend celebrating my birthday and we had a lovely stay. The location allowed direct entry to one of the many malls in Saigon as well as across the street there being a beautiful park to take pictures.

Check in is at 2pm and we checked in at 3pm due to our flight being delayed. We were hoping our room would be ready upon arrival, however we were told to wait a bit since the room was not ready.

Regardless, once we were shown our rooms, we had a pleasant view of the city and the room had nice design as well as good amenities.

One of the most magnificent views you can have anywhere in the world.
The rooms are designed for sleeping only with spectacular views.
The breakfast bar is splendid with local and international choices.i highly recommended you try at least 2 nights

data.formatted_address: 80 Trương Định, Phường Bến Thành, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam
data.name: Di tích mộ cổ họ Lâm

reviews.text: Yeah really good place to go to, a nice park with lots of seats and some sports equipment for everyone to use.

Vestigate of Familiar Lam's tomb is a architectural legacy of Saigon. The Tomb was build in approx 1795 which belong to Mr Lam Tam Lang & his wife. This is a quite famous family. Mr Lang is the first man of Lam Family, which have a lot of well-known persons as general Lam Quang Ky ( vice-general of Nguyen Trung Truc), Lam Quang Phong (colonel of Vietnam Republic Army) & Lam Dinh Phung aka Lam Phuong ( the famous song writer of Vietnam, aka King of Bolero style)
Cool park. Lots of pokestops. I dont care about pokemon go anymore, but if u do. This place will make u happy.
just an ancient tomb, it is not very special, little know know about cultural and architect.
Flower Festival next door

data.formatted_address: Bình An, Quận 2, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam
data.name: Saigon River Embankment

reviews.text: Enjoyable river cruise experience. The seafood menu was delicious. Hope more halal cuisine esp the beefsteak.

Cool place in D2 to come for a little bit. Soak in the views. Easy access on a motorbike down a couple small alleys. Cars won't be able to fit. Once at the riverside, it opens up. Can walk around a bit. There were some food and drink stands in the immediate area.

A bit crowded, great view of the city, cheap food, drinks were a bit too sweet for my taste but can't demand more.
Parking expensive 8k/ bike
Nice place for walking
love the views, love cruising along saigon river going to Landmark destination.

data.formatted_address: QPVG+65J, Vinhomes Central Park, Bình Thạnh, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
data.name: Đài quan sát Vinhomes Central Park

reviews.text: Nice spot to view the entire vinhomes area.

Everything is good. Here also have statue look same like NY CITY one.
But after 9:30 PM they sill turn off the lightning and kick you out
Nice observation deck overlooking the river, but nothing spectacular about the view.

I love it. But you should come either before 9 a.m. or after 4. Otherwise there is no shade. It's miserably hot.
But it's very lively at night. Very clean, safe. Very beautiful. There aren't many places for long walks in Saigon, but this is one of them. There is a mall there too and lots of cafe.
Great view and a nice breeze in the evening

data.formatted_address: 5B Đ. Tôn Đức Thắng, Bến Nghé, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam
data.name: The Landmark

reviews.text:
Excellent 5 star stay all around.

Half of the building is comprised of serviced apartments like ours and the other half is occupied by businesses.

Guest parking is on level three. One side is for bikes and the other is for cars.

Our stay included gym access with rock climbing wall and a nice roof top pool with views of the river.

The place is very secure with 24 hr security and the front desk manned at all hours as well.

Free washer/dryer facilities but you provide your own detergent.

Full stove/oven, microwave, and mini fridge with freezer and so many utensils and cookware.

Everyone was friendly and the studio provided everything we needed and much, much more!

I wouldn’t hesitate to stay here again.
The only unfortunate thing was that their balcony rooms were all occupied so I’d try to book one several months in advance next time around because those looked really nice.

*Note: you must book directly through them via their website.

I needed a swim and workout while in Ho Chi Min city and it was perfect.

Sauna, yoga studio, bouldering gym above the city, squash court, swimming pool and more. For very reasonable price too
Excellent accomodation n River Views

A very beautiful and luxurious hotel in Saigon Vietnam. It is located in a very prime area which is not far from the market too.
In addition, one can get the splendid view of sky and the Saigon river from the balcony of this hotel.
It is equipped with all the modern amenities including spa and swimming pool.
Moreover, food quality is awesome.

Conveniently located in district 1 of Ho Chi minh city and just a walking distance from the most famous locations of Saigon. Shopping centrs are also so close that you don't need to rent a car or take a taxi. Just walk everywhere.
Food ( breakfast) is being served in the room so there's no restaurant facility inside however a complete kitchen supplies comes with the room amenities.
Very polite personnel and helpful.  They agreed on our late check out without an extra charge.
Good TV channels in different languages were always available.
Internet was also superfast.
Gym and swimming pool on the roof is having picturesque views on Saigon river.
I liked and do recommend this hotel.will most probably return soon 🙏👍

data.formatted_address: 720a Đ. Điện Biên Phủ, Vinhomes Tân Cảng, Bình Thạnh, Hồ Chí Minh 72324, Vietnam
data.name: Landmark 2

reviews.text:
Desk employees need to improve their service. It is just laughable that instead of helping, one guy just look in the mirror the whole time. More time to making himself look pretty. Refusing to help guests with questions or help with the elevator to go up to visit family. Why does he think a fingerprint would help to go up?

Another instance that they laugh at a foreign relative of mine who was just asking for help to go into the gym. Talking trash in Vietnamese behind his back. Why would you do that..? Why do you have to be this disgusting, bad look..

Seems like living in the Landmark buildings is a joke in how people get treated there. I don't understand how the central park buildings are way more friendlier and helpful. Well if you act like dogs, I'll treat you like one.

The first floor running machine was broken a month ago and it is still not fixed 😡 Residences who go to the gym have trouble. please help!!!!

ps: we told the desk people already for the problem.  how come they like to decorate the front place(reception desk). but dont care for inside of the apartment.
Good
Staying with them. So dirty bedroom
great place to be around

data.formatted_address: QPVF+V4Q, Vinhomes Central Park, Bình Thạnh, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
data.name: Landmark 81 Park

reviews.text: Best place to see the full moon, camping, running or just simple a relaxing walk. They have bbq and picnic area, clean restroom and  playground for kid. It's perfect for a night walk. I feel safe here.
Fantastic park to look to spend time with family and friends looking at the tallest building in Vietnam (at the time) with the river in the background. Great atmosphere and amazing vibes at the park.
It's beautiful and great to enjoy a walk in the evening!
Crowded and brightburn
Chill

data.formatted_address: 720A Đ. Điện Biên Phủ, Phường 22, Bình Thạnh, Hồ Chí Minh 700000, Vietnam
data.name: Vinpearl Landmark 81, Autograph Collection

reviews.text:
This is my first time visiting this hotel. The front desk is very friendly and helpful. My room  was upgraded to corner suite with astonishing views! Due to tight schedules, I don’t have chance to see the lounge and fitness center. But feels great to this hotel. Definitely plan to visit here soon!

Breakfast in the longe was amazing! You really should try it!

Stayed 3 nights at the second tallest building in South East Asia. Least to say, the views were spectacular and amazing.

Rooms were very clean and nice, though the toilet decor seemed to be a bit dated.

Service was great. Not sure if due to the language barrier, but sometimes had difficulty communicating with concierge and guest services. Property staff did try their best to accommodate to needs and request. Extra mention for the footmen, who were very helpful and the waiters at the bar, who were attentive, patient and friendly (note: a few of the drinks at the Bar are spicy, though they weren’t labelled as such on the menu)

Location is a bit far from the city centre, not walking distance. It took us around 10-15 minutes to get there by Grab. There is a shopping mall complex next door, but there wasn’t much to see in terms of shops and was nothing special.

The gym was spacious and clean. Liked working out to an amazing view too.

Breakfast was great. They offered a variety of options ranging from Vietnamese to Eggs Benedict. I mainly opted for the Pho and Chao every morning, which was very tasty.

All in all would most definitely stay again. The price for the views are worth it alone.

Fantastic hotel with a stunning view and staff!! The hotel is relatively new and spotless. All the staff was amiable, and we got upgraded. The view from the room was nice. Club Lounge has plenty of options with a food and drink menu. Breakfast was excellent, and my favorite was freshly made smoothies. It's connected to the mall, that it was very convenient. I highly recommend it for any vacation. I’d definitely come back!!

It was a beautiful stay! The rooms were lovely, albeit on the smaller side, but very well equipped. Service was above and beyond. I would definitely recommend and would be more than happy to stay here again. My only (small) complaint is that the location is a little out of the way.

One of the best hotels I've stayed ever...

This is the tallest building in Vietnam. We got a panoramic view / full glass view of the city / and river. Sunset view.

We stayed for 5 nights, spend half the time in the hotel itself, using the facilities and pool, spa...

Staff was very friendly, breakfast had some veg / vegan options as well.

Same building has sky deck view and a mall

Overall amazing place

data.formatted_address: Chill bến Bình An, 52-54 Số 20, P. Bình An, Quận 2, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam
data.name: View landmark

reviews.text:
Airy and beautiful view,
Large parking lot
Drinks are relatively okay
The only downside is that there are a lot of mosquitoes.

Beautiful view, great atmosphere at this location with a direct view of Landmark 81 and the Saigon River. This is the ideal place to enjoy lemon tea, coffee and milk tea. Abundant snacks and airy space create a unique culinary experience and are ideal for taking photos, chilling with friends, and relieving stress.
Full view of lammart, open space, reasonable price menu (but it takes a long time for customers to order).
Spacious and airy with a direct view of the landmark. Park your car at the 10k parking lot, there are many snack cars around.

Instead of taking an expensive cruise for a long time, take a short ride on an inexpensive water bus. If you look at the skyscrapers while having a drink, you'll be back in no time. There is almost no reserved seating.

data.formatted_address: Trần Trọng Kim, Phường 22, Bình Thạnh, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam
data.name: Công viên Vinhomes Central Park

reviews.text: Can easily spend 1.5 to 2 hours walking, exploring and taking photos. Avoid the times of high heat and sun exposure. I went at 4 pm and spent till 6 pm there. It felt good being there. Looked modern and clean. Plus point is I got to see a rainbow. Happy Pride Month, everyone.

I like this park. There are many trees, playgrounds for children. Infrastructures of the park are excellent such as Japanese gardens, Europe buildings, etc. Another advantage is the food and beverage is extremely cheap, i can’t imagine that! Overall 5 out of 5

Vinhomes Central Park, located in Binh Thanh district, Ho Chi Minh, is a great destination for both locals and tourists. With an area of ​​up to 14 hectares, the park is designed in the style of Central Park in New York, creating a cool green space in the heart of the bustling city.

The park has many diverse amenities and play areas, including a sports complex, children's play area, and a system of football fields and golf courses. In particular, prominent check-in points such as the red overpass, American-style fountain, and Japanese garden always attract a large number of young people to take photos.

Another highlight of the park is the BBQ area, where you can organize a picnic or barbecue outside. The park is also located next to the Saigon River, providing clear views and fresh air, very suitable for outdoor activities such as jogging and cycling.

In addition, the park is also close to Vincom Landmark 81 shopping center, making it easy for visitors to combine fun, shopping and enjoying cuisine in one trip.

The park's opening hours are from 5:00 a.m. to 9:30 p.m., and admission is free, making it easy for everyone to visit and experience.

Vinhomes Central Park is an ideal destination for those who want to find a green, airy and fully equipped space in the heart of Saigon

Amazing green space in the middle of the city. Lots of space to walk around, picnic shelters available for reservation, a small Japanese garden, tennis court, basketball court, and tons of great views.

Awesome park nestled in the heart of Saigon Pearl with great views of Landmark 81 and Saigon River. If you’re looking for a quiet break from all the honking, this is the spot you’re looking for.

We strolled around this park and ended up spending an entire hour here.

data.formatted_address: QPRH+X27, Đ. Số 21, P. Bình An, Quận 2, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam
data.name: View Sông Landmark

data.formatted_address: On the 9th floor of Duc Vuong Hotel, 195 Đ. Bùi Viện, Phường Phạm Ngũ Lão, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh 700000, Vietnam
data.name: The View Rooftop Bar

reviews.text:
This is a great rooftop bar near the lively bar street in Ho Chi Minh City. 8th floor so you can both see the city skyline but also the local surroundings.

It’s the perfect spot if you want good music, great drinks, and a chill vibe without the usual crowds. The staff is very friendly, highly recommend!

This is an uptight restaurant in the middle of Bui Vien Street. Distant from the chaos of the street this restaurant offers you a peaceful and calm rooftop dining experience. Probably not the thing that most people will be visiting the street..but yesh it's always good to have options.

The staff is very kind and tries to help you with all the info that's needed. The food and ambiance is a bit bland for the price though.

A nice rooftop bar high above the walking street area. It's got multiple levels, so there's plenty of space to sit and take in the views. It's more of a bar to sit around and chat, as there's no music or dancefloor. Lots of photo-taking opportunities. Prices are standard walking street prices. They take credit card here too. Service was efficient and professional.

So far this is the best rooftop bar for me in Saigon, They have the best view, very good atmosphere, and the staff are very nice. Prices are reasonable for this kinda spot. They got craft beers and so many other options.

Back again, last time was 7 years and the place hasn't changed. A great place to get away from the street heat. The beers a little bit more pricey up here, but worth it. Located on the 9th floor you get a reasonable good view of the city. Nice selection of food and a perfect place to have breakfast...to get away from the hustle and bustle at the street level

data.formatted_address: Tầng 26 - 27, AB Tower, 76A Đ. Lê Lai, Phường Bến Thành, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh 700000, Vietnam
data.name: Chill Skybar & Dining

reviews.text:
The view is absolutely stunning from the top.
However, the cocktails were mid and it was strange how we had to wait for chairs to be delivered to us. Had to wait a few minutes on an empty table standing.

Otherwise, the sky top employees were nice and professional but the two ladies at the entrance on ground floor had an attitude and kept laughing for whatever reason when approaching us which was strange.

Would recommend if you like loud music and would like to see some beautiful view at night.

Spectacular views from level 26, we went at night but apparently the sunset is nice to see as well from up there. Very pricey for some drinks, they did make me a special request (amaretto sour) which wasn’t on the cocktail list, service www brilliant and all staff spoke perfect English.
You’re not allowed to wear flip flops, however if you give a VND500,000 security deposit they lend shoes instead of turning you away which is good. They were quite comfy actually. The DJ turns the music up around 9pm and the coloured disco lights come on too, which was our queue to leave because that’s not our vibe, but would be good if you liked that kind of thing

Great spot to have some good cuisine by actual culinary artists.  There is music at the skybar which was super loud, but I chose to get away from it and just relaxed in the restaurant for some deliciously created food.

As a culinary artist myself, I found the food was well prepared and the chefs expressed their art very well.

I would definitely go back again.

Good cocktails, but very overpriced. I’m not sure why they call it “Chill Skybar” because there’s nothing chill about it. The music is very loud. The view is very nice though, that was the best part about the experience. We definitely won’t be coming back.

We went there on Wednesday.  Got there around 8:30 pm. It was a chilling when we arrived. About an hour later it was a little busier. Wonderful vibe. Amazing views, nice cocktails, friendly staff. Dress code applied, no tank-top, no flip-flops/sandals.

data.formatted_address: Lầu 10, 65-67-69 Đ. Nguyễn Thái Bình, Phường Nguyễn Thái Bình, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh 700000, Vietnam
data.name: BÚP Sky Cuisine

reviews.text:
BÚP Sky Cuisine is an absolute gem in the heart of Saigon! The panoramic view from the rooftop is simply breathtaking, offering a stunning backdrop for unforgettable moments

My family and I recently hosted a dinner here and it was an absolute delight. The staff was incredibly friendly and attentive, making us feel truly welcomed

The food was an explosion of flavors! Every dish was a masterpiece, beautifully presented and bursting with taste. From the appetizers to the main courses, everything was simply perfect. And let's not forget about the happy hour! Enjoying delicious drinks with loved ones while taking in the city lights was pure bliss

If you're looking for a magical dining experience, BÚP is a must-visit! You won't be disappointed.

Rooftop restaurant on the 10th floor of ode hotel. Quaint soothing environment. Staff is very friendly and English speaking. Ordered Ahi Taco, Nachos and Bone Marrow for starters. For main - Singaporean noodles, Skinny duck, Spaghetti, Tuna Steak, fried rice with prawns. Tacos and Duck were good but everything else was fairly bland. Overall the food lacked flavour.

Went here for my birthday dinner & the staff was friendly and accommodating to all of our needs. The food was delicious & the view was a nice touch. The price was decent for a rooftop. Would come again if we have the chance to head back to HCMC.

western cuisine restaurant that holds its ranking high and justified. many yummy dishes to consider and come with good prices. the space and decorations are standard, yet the outdoor seating offers great view of the city as it is located on the 10th floor. well trained staff. free parking for motorbikes. recommended.

Guys- this is a must try place while in Ho Chi Minh, amazing atmosphere , exceptional customer service, they are super careful of even small requests, the views are amazing despite being on only 10th floor, very nicely made place. And to top it all, food quality is top notch, one of the best pastas I’ve had here.

Super reasonable also in terms of price considering rooftop and quality food!!!

data.formatted_address: 24th floor, 76-78 Đ. Nguyễn Thị Minh Khai, Phường 6, Quận 3, Hồ Chí Minh 700000, Vietnam
data.name: Social Club Rooftop Bar

reviews.text:
A fantastic place for a cocktail overlooking the city. We stayed at the hotel and came up to the bar for a few drinks during sunset. The bar offers a large choice of cocktails, as well as a happy hour with reasonable prices. You can also have your welcome drink here if you are an Accor Hotels silver member or above.

Friendly wait and bar staff with a good service and a fantastic view over Ho Chi Minh City, with a good variety of stools, tables and comfy sofas. Great for a few chilled out drinks watching the sun set.

Social club above Saigon is a great addition to the M Gallery where we staying. Drinks are excellent. Really enjoyed the tie me up tie me down. Nice breeze up here music not too loud. Great atmosphere with a nice pool. Space great for a date
Excellent experience at the incredible roof top bar! Top of the line service! Many people helped, but leader Lee was absolutely wonderful. Amazing ambience, great snacks, and fabulous drinks.

The best rooftop bar in downtown. I have been in a few t try rooftop bars in downtown but so far Saigon Sociak Club rooftop is the best:
- the vibe
- the spcae
- the drink
- the service
We came here 3 times and each time we Really enjoyed the sunset and the vibe here.

Nice rooftop bar perched in the city centre. The cocktails here are nothing to write home about but the ambience is great: from the skyline views of Saigon to the live DJ and even an infinity pool on the side, you could certainly do a lot worse for a post work / dinner drink

data.formatted_address: 19-23 Lam Son Square, Bến Nghé, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam
data.name: Saigon Saigon Rooftop Bar(Caravelle Hotel)

reviews.text:
The view is nothing special but still okay. You can sit outside and inside. Service was pleasant. The drinks are good but in my opinion too expensive. For my Aperol Spritz I payed almost 330k Dong.
I really enjoyed my stay here until they turned on some dance/club music way too loud without any reason. There were only about 5 tables occupied and nobody was dancing or anything. Other guests were obviously bothered too. Therefore, that I couldn’t really enjoy it due to the music (I just left quickly when it was turned on because it bothered me so much), the price  is way too high!

We largely came to Saigon Saigon Bar for the historical aspect of war correspondents gathering here during the war. All my respect to those individuals, I couldn’t imagine being a part of that… although it would have been cool to be a journalist back then lowkey… It’s also interesting how in Vietnam they refer to it as the “American War” where in the US we refer to it as the “Vietnam War.” I guess I should have known that as it makes total sense, but just really never gave it any thought.

Anyways, this place was a must see for the aforementioned historical aspect. To stand where those journalists, politicians, and soldiers stood to get away from the war for a brief moment by enjoying an ice cold one.

As for being an actual bar, it was one of the most expensive drinks we had on our entire trip. RUNNIN our pockets… I mean it still came out to like $12 usd for a Negroni which would be highway robbery in New York.

The nightlife aspect and views are decent, but there are much better sky bars in the city if that’s what your priorities are.

For me, the historical aspect sold me so I am 100% happy I came and will be back when I am in Ho Chi Minh again. I felt inspired in here.

IG @jnov_
Tiktok @jnov_reviews

Lovely spot to grab a bottle of prosecco when the short rainfall session came...

View is perfect looking down on the opera theater and almost as good looking from all other 180 degrees the balcony wraps around the building!
Nice place to have a drink during sunset. They offer happy hour cocktails (until 19:00). I tried all of them and they tasted awesome!

Great vibes! Very nice rooftop view at sunset, with happy hour (50% off drinks up until 7 pm) and nice music.

Staff is super! Thanks to Dung for the great service

data.formatted_address: 2F Nguyễn, Thi Sách, Bến Nghé, TP, Hồ Chí Minh 70000, Vietnam
data.name: Apocalypse Now Sai Gon

reviews.text: Good Atmosphere, crowd on Sunday, good place to enjoy, nice music , nice staff, it worth to visit.

The drinks are not great. You have to pay in advance before your drinks come. Price of drink here is cheap in a bar of D1 but the quality you get is fairly low. Music is average. I like the old Apocalypse Now, not this one. Feel that they changed style, owner and its small, full of chicks. Didnt feel to come back.

It re-opened in much smaller location than in the years since 1991 just in April 2023. Give it a try and support to bring it back to former fame!
Be careful with offers you don't need and want but the people working there are really kind! Good party and drinks at reasonable prices.
Longest bar in Saigon, Good Place for tourist, nice music .

My review is based only about the bad staff outside. Imagine the guy is paid for sitting on a chair and while there are plenty of space in front of the bar at 8:30 pm, he yell at me to go park elsewhere without giving proper explanation. When I ask to know why, because someone else just parked at same time (maybe a friend), he didn't provide any reasons.
I can see he has almost no vocabulary in english and that is ok because I am the foreigner, but in that case, if these spota are for VIP or staff and you cant speak english, put a sign!!! This bald guy felt oppressed by my simple question, even if I talked nicely, but his reaction was to become more and more aggressive. What an amazing employee....
Well done, you lost minimum one good dancer and customer!

data.formatted_address: 13-17 Đ. Đồng Khởi, Bến Nghé, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh 700000, Vietnam
data.name: SEI Dining Lounge

reviews.text: We tried SEI's set menu tonight and it was great. We love how they presented each dish. The taste is unique and clean. A good mix of flavors yet does not overpower the main ingredients. The overall atmosphere was light and fun. There was a jazz trio playing during the time and they made the experience even more magical. Worth visiting. We will definitely come back again.

We went here a couple months ago and we love the ambiance. The food was decent tho. We did not drink much but then the bartenders were so polite and kind to offer us free drinks. There werent many customers back then, which I like. Overall, I would recommend this to friends.
Love the atmosphere at Sei Dining Lounge. Very good food, nice decoration, and great service.

Amazing Asian Fusion Dining. I ordered medium rare steak but got a medium well one. But the flavor is top notch. Definitely will come back 👏🏻
They have Freeflow for lady from 9pm-11pm so take advantage of the hot deal 👏🏻
Absolutely amazing place to go in Saigon. A must place to visit if you are in Ho Chi Minh city! ♥️♥️♥️

data.formatted_address: 180 Đ. Nguyễn Công Trứ, Phường Nguyễn Thái Bình, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam
data.name: Chill Garden

reviews.text: Lovely view but that’s all that was. Went for 1 drink each for happy hour. Good service with 4 people serving us at one time, giving us water and pouring it in iced glasses alongside wet napkin packets. Come to asking for the Bill , our drinks where the correct price but they had a 100K charge on water which was crazy, they do not tell you this when they open it and pour it for you. So that was 200K for two small bottles of water. Be aware of sneaky charges. The ‘Evian’ in the receipt is the water.

Used to be good.. but now, very bad promoter. We were charged 400k for entry and advised that there is an event and live music.. but we waited from 9pm until 11pm.. yet nothing happened, but just DJ playing techno music. We feel cheated and disappointed… so we left.

Comfortable space, nice view, but not good.  The teacup was dirty when being served, we had to exchange it 3 times because all 3 cups were dirty, the cake served and tea were not standard.  In general it's fine with me, not too bad

Best view of city center
Very good service
Many options for all kind of drinks
Nice place, 15th floor TNR tower
180 Nguyen Cong Tru st., dist.1, HCMC
Great view, so so food with hefty price, old restaurant. Amazing view.

data.formatted_address: 224 Đ. Đề Thám, Phường Phạm Ngũ Lão, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh 77000, Vietnam
data.name: Thi Bar Saigon

reviews.text:
Really loved this bar!
Came here on a weeknight and enjoyed Noff Band playing an absolute variety of hits.
Both the male and female vocalists had breathtaking voices and the band played very well too. Cocktails were good quality and affordable. Only complaint is that they close too early and not open on Tuesday.
Look forward to visiting here again.

The bar will have music show at 10:00 PM and end at 11:30 at the weekend. Has no chance to visit on weekday no wondering if there is a shown in that time. Very enthusiastic performance. They sing and play US UK back in 2010s. Surprise that they can sing Poly Poly (Korean) song as well. LGBTQ+ friendly. Apple Pay is applicable

Four nights spent in HCMC, three of which we visited Thi Bar. Great Live Music venue with excellent nightly bands.

Reasonably priced drinks and attentive and friendly staff. Great LGBT+ hangout. Good mix of foreigners and locals. Arrive before the band, especially at weekends as it gets busy!

“Beer, Cocktail or me” the hit slogan that sets the mood for the awesome gay bar in Saigon.
The “The De Tham Street” signature tequila cocktail with its tropical heat kept us rolling along on a wild night of live music, good company and an all round great night out. The owner is friendly and has a good eye for weekly style and art, fun live music and a good vibe.

The staff are friendly and attentive.
Be mindful that it can get very busy, so get in before tables fill up.
Can only recommend to anyone looking for a cool gay bar in Saigon, that goes up and in excitement and pace as the night goes on.  Will return again.
Music was good. Band was awesome. Prices high and staff dull and not interested. Better customer service across the road in walking street.

data.formatted_address: 102, ABC, Đ. Cống Quỳnh, Phường Phạm Ngũ Lão, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh 70000, Vietnam
data.name: Banana Mama Rooftop Bar & Kitchen Saigon

reviews.text: It is a good place to chill and enjoy the night with your friends and love ones. The price of the drinks is reasonable and very nice view. You are able to spot the plane takeoff and landing from the airport as well.
The chicken burger was absolutely amazing! Cocktails were also very good. The ambience is so relaxed and chill, perfect for a sunset in Ho Chi Minh
Cozy rooftop bar with open space, kind staffs. Tropical bar vibe especially sunset time. Good food, fresh cocktail.
Fantastic bar to catch a sunset at. Loved the happy hour drinks (4-6pm) and vibey music!
Perfect rooftop bar for meeting friends, music is on point and just enough for chitchat. Great view, good drinks in a breeze, so what we need more during a friend talk!

data.formatted_address: 180 Lý Tự Trọng, Phường Bến Thành, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh 700000, Vietnam
data.name: Twilight Sky Bar

reviews.text:
Great drinks, good service, great views.  The juxtaposition of old and new, sipping modern cocktails listening to music from the 20s and then switching it to a live band.

The drinks can be slow so order before you finish your first.  Try a drink from their specials list, you won’t regret it.

Perfect place to unwind after a long day of sightseeing or if you have a date you want to impress.

What a fantastic gem of a place. Views are 360 & stunning. Such a lovely atmosphere, the decor is very cute and the staff are very lovely. Huy served our table, and we absolutely loved him. Thank You for a wonderful time.

This is the best rooftop bar in Ho Chi Minh City! The view is amazing, offering a stunning panorama of the city. The drinks menu is extensive, and every drink we tried was delicious. The music selection was excellent, creating a relaxed and enjoyable atmosphere. Special mention to the staff member Hur, whose service was exceptional and made our experience even more enjoyable. We will definitely be coming back!

How wonderful. It's just that the mocktail I ordered was a bit sour, probably not to my taste. Overall, everything is good. The staff here are wonderful. Especially bartender Dan. He asked after me when he saw me sitting alone. I will definitely come back next time

Awesome place for some drinks at night, at the top of a really nice hotel. Was welcomed by the outside doorman who brought us inside and into the elevator.   Didn't try the food so can't judge. Not sure if there was a full time person upstairs on the top level but they did come around.  Definitely would be a perfect after dinner date place but also good just for anyone to go up and relax

data.formatted_address: Floor 8, 198 Đ. Bùi Viện, Phường Phạm Ngũ Lão, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam
data.name: Le'Fê Rooftop Bar

reviews.text: This place is an absolute gem! It has such a relaxed and chilled atmosphere and the staff are so wonderful. Really quiet place as it is on the very top floor (lots of steps but totally worth it). Amazing view of Bui Vien and the city skyline from their rooftop bar. My partner and I spent a few hours here, even though a heavy downpour. 100% recommend this place to anyone who can't handle the chaos from the street.

Came here with some friends & enjoyed the rooftop views & tranquility. Roughly four flights up and it felt so hidden away & private. Helpful bartenders. Enjoyed it immensely. My friends had a Saigon beer (80K) and my partner has the rooster beer (100K). We came here from a restaurant that charged two portions of VAT so it was nice coming here & not being charged VAT.

I wanted to have a rooftop view at the Bui Vien Street, I found this LeFe Rooftop Bar. The location was great, the atmosphere was good too. It was very windy during the night. The price was a little bit higher than the usual bar for beer, but with such a great location, what else to compare with.

A cozy rooftop bar with great views of the city. The staff and very friendly and welcoming, from the doorman on the street to the waiters in the bar they were all so kind and accommodating. The drink and food selection is great with a combination of both Vietnamese food and western food. I would definitely go back again!

Mt favorite bar in bui viet walking street!
Not too much advertising, and no security guys try to drag you into the store.
You have to find the store by yourself through the hotel gate!
The bar was very cute, chill and cozy. Not too big but have good drink, good view and good staff! Everything was perfect! Feels like a secret place! and the price was also reasonable!

data.formatted_address: 17 Le Duan, Ben Nghe Ward, Bến Nghé, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh 700000, Vietnam
data.name: Boudoir Lounge

reviews.text: The bar has been re decorate into a cozy vibe, and the FnB team is very helpful to settle down everything I need for my small event 👍

I had a seabass, gin tonic and beer.
The price was normal, the taste was good! And manager Mr.Lien was kind and took good care of customer, recommend!

I’ve stayed in the Sofitel hotel for the last 4-5 years. My recent visit to the Boudoir lounge this past week was incredible. I was actually ready to walk around the city to find a local restaurant for dinner but decided to check it out. The service and staff are so friendly and accommodating. Bartender Brian and James are both skilled. The manager Tu was very nice and polite along with the personable ladies who were more than welcoming and very warm. Thank you so much for the delicious food and cocktails. I’ll be back soon for more.
Great ambience. Nice place to meet up with my colleagues after work.
The french pastries and cocktails are amazingggg

data.formatted_address: 3 Đ. Nguyễn Thị Minh Khai, Đa Kao, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh 700000, Vietnam
data.name: Thảo Cầm Viên Sài Gòn

reviews.text:
Ticket: 60,000 vnd (adult), 40,000 vnd (kid).
Nice place to visit in the city.
Not crowded during weekday.
Let's support the zoo.

A beautiful zoo with a lot to see. The land area itself is reasonable so the walking distance around is good for most people. The animals all look healthy and taken care of. It's an older zoo, but I actually like that look. The monkeys were my favorite part to see, but their are drafts, elephants, rhinos, tigers, lions and many other animals to see.

The rides weren't operational when I came, I'm not certain when they operate them. We came on a weekday around 10 a.m.

Watch your step, feel free to donate money to this zoo too. They could really use the support.

The experience was great if you don't mind all the depressed animals. There is a great variety of animals. A lot of stuff to do as well. The zoo also has a theme park and botanical gardens. Plenty of restaurants and activities. Very quiet during the week. Entry was 80k per person.

We had a good experience at the zoo with our 3 young children. There were plenty of animals to see and it was quite easy to get around. There were plenty of refreshment areas to get a cold drink or ice cream, and there were amusement rides, however we didn’t use them.

I have other suggestions for places to go out on the weekend. 😆
Thao Cam Vien - The Sai Gon Zoo and Botanical Garden is also a good option for spending your weekend if you don't want to go far.😚😚
The first thing I am impressed with is that there are many massive trees so the weather is so good. You will feel relaxed when you visit there.
The second thing, If you are so stressed with human, you should go and visit your "friends". They are so cute, friendly, and lazy. Almost time I always see them sleep.🤣🤣
Maybe the last thing, You will have a nice, outdoor album. Take a camera and one friend hangs out with you. I think you can have beautiful pictures to post on social media.

I had a nice weekend, and how about you? 😘😘

data.formatted_address: 2JXG+G42, Tân Định, Bến Cát, Binh Duong 823480, Vietnam
data.name: Dai Nam Zoo

reviews.text: The zoo is quite spacious, requiring approximately 45 minutes to explore on foot. However, it would be even more enjoyable if the zoo offered a greater variety of animals to observe.

The zoo is spacious and shows quite some animals. The good thing is that the exotic animals are in a similar habitat as their own
The sad thing is that some of them kept alone. The elephants are obviously old, lonely and at least one has a serious leg injury. The young bear is lonely and you could see his sadness, too.
Great place lots of entertainment for everyone.  Golf carts run you around to where ever you want to go.  Lots of restaurants.  Staff are willing and helpful not expensive!

Even though this is a good place and well invested but the ticket price seems quite high. You may have free visiting temples, pagodas but for other side you have to get a ticket for it. Some areas are being constructed or repaired, quite small numbers of animals in the zoo too.
Recommend renting a bicycle to see the large zoo. Lots of animals to enjoy.

data.formatted_address: 100 Đ. Nguyễn Hữu Cảnh, Bến Nghé, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam
data.name: Saigon Zoo - Khu Gấu Chó

reviews.text: I don't support the zoo but my mother wanted so much to visit there. We regretted it so much! It was very dirty, poor animals and many cages were empty. So cheap entrance but not worth.

Review of Saigon Zoo - Khu Gấu Chó:

Visiting the Saigon Zoo - Khu Gấu Chó, a gem located in the heart of Ho Chi Minh City, was a unique urban experience. Its central location offers great accessibility, allowing visitors to get up close and personal with a diverse range of animals. The opportunity to interact with various creatures in the midst of the city truly provided a distinctive experience.

Furthermore, the affordable ticket prices offer excellent value for money. For those traveling in the city, the chance to connect with nature and animals at the Saigon Zoo - Khu Gấu Chó is undoubtedly one of the must-visit places in Ho Chi Minh City.

I visited the zoo today and it didn’t feel like a zoo, (I am from Germany and we have very clean and organised zoo’s) it was very wild, the water from lakes or from the animals  was mostly dirty and looked like not taken care off. In some places it also came with a strong odour.

I think some of the animals looked very sick, they had wounds, loss of hair & were super skinny.

But I do have to say they had a big variety of animals I haven’t seen before.

I hope they will make more space for the animals and take better care and feed them better.

The entrance is only 60k I would be more than happy to pay double if I know the animals have a better life. It was also fairly empty not many people were around.

Many rides for younger kids to distract them from the heat. I wish there were more info in English about the animals. Saw few signs of public toilets throughout the zoo, but didn't use them, so I can't tell if it's good or bad. The thrash cans around the zoo were overflow from the day before. Nice tropical plants and trees, plenty of shades.
Please free these poor animals !

data.formatted_address: 110 Đ. Nguyễn Hữu Cảnh, Bến Nghé, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam
data.name: Khỉ Sóc - Saigon Zoo

reviews.text: Please fill up the water tanks and pools for the otters, they need water to be happy. This was sad to see a lot of these animal cages not well maintained. Please fix it asap for the animals. Thank you.
Very good place for vacation with family
Interesting

The squirrel area is a paradise for cute little squirrels. You can watch them jumping from tree to tree, creating lovely and vibrant scenes. This is an ideal place to relax and enjoy the cuteness of this animal.
Cool

data.formatted_address: 62, 4A Nguyễn Ngọc Phương, Phường 19, Bình Thạnh, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam
data.name: Voi - Asia Elephant - Saigon Zoo

reviews.text: Beautiful & big trees seen from the other side of the canal. This place adds a green part to the city. You can go jogging here early morning. Avoid holidays since there will be a big crowd. I don't want to mention about the animals' condition here

The elephant stable near Thi Nghe canal of the Saigon Zoo and Botanical Garden is a must-see check-in location of this place.
With elegant architecture and elephant lodge arches painted in yellow, it is quite unique and cute.
Here we can buy small pieces of sugarcane to feed the elephants, about 5k 10k per piece, allowing the children to experience feeding the elephant sugarcane through its adorable trunk hihi.

As I approached the elephant area, I was impressed by their huge size and strength. I couldn't help but be in awe of the natural beauty and family affection in the elephant herd. The huge elephants move gracefully and caress each other by touching each other with their trunks.

The Elephant Sanctuary and the Elephant Sanctuary are great places to interact with large animals. You can admire the majesty and power of the stars and feel the immensity of the elephants. These are memorable experiences and create cherished memories. There is a bit of a strong smell of feces here, so please limit eating and drinking in this area
BE GOOD TO ANIMALS, THEY ARE VERY CUTE AND DO NOT HARM HUMANS, WE SHOULD LOVE AND PROTECT THEM, I HOPE 1 DAY NEARLY THIS PLACE IS NOT A PRISON BUT A HAPPY PLACE FOR ANIMALS !!!

data.formatted_address: 2 Đ. Nguyễn Bỉnh Khiêm, Bến Nghé, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam
data.name: Vườn bướm

reviews.text: Good place to spend a morning with kids. Lots of reviews on here about it being dirty and poor conditions. It’s certainly old but didn’t seem like animals were miss treated. It’s Vietnam, I don’t think you can expect more.
Poor elephants

The butterfly garden is located in the Zoo complex, I saw many types of butterflies, convenient for people to visit and learn.
There is no need to buy tickets here because there are already entrance tickets.

The butterfly garden has just opened, entering is a small room to introduce and collect various types of butterflies and bugs. Going behind is a small flower garden with butterflies fluttering so it's very beautiful.

The Butterfly Garden is a great area for butterfly lovers. You can watch colorful butterflies flying in the natural space, creating a beautiful and relaxing landscape. In addition to butterflies, there are also many strange plants here, so bring children to visit to experience all kinds of animals.
