data.formatted_address: 123 Lý Tự Trọng, Phường Bến Thành, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh 700000, Vietnam
data.name: Vietnam Adventure Tours

reviews.text: My husband and I had an incredible time exploring the Cu Chi Tunnels and Mekong Delta with Mekong Delta Tour from Ho Chi Minh City! Harry, our tour guide, was an absolute gem – friendly, knowledgeable, and incredibly patient throughout the entire journey. He made the experience truly unforgettable by sharing insights into the local history and culture. The tour provided delicious local lunch and snacks at various stops, which added to the authenticity of the experience. They picked us up at our hotel and dropped us off at the end. Though it was a bit lengthy, every moment was worth it. Plus, the price was relatively affordable, making it even more appealing. We wholeheartedly recommend this tour to anyone visiting the area. Thanks to Harry and the team at Mekong Delta Tour for a fantastic adventure!

i had a wonderful one day tour to coconut kingdom Mekong Delta river on 11th May. It was fantastic, very well organized by the tour company. We had a group of around 24 and we all enjoyed it. We stopped at Buddha temple then moved to coconut kingdom where we enjoyed Vietnamese music and vegetables. Then we went to the beehive center. We were showed a cobra wine and they offered us the same but i did not dare to drink it. We were also showed how coconut candies are made in Vietnam. Finally we had a 20 minute boat ride and Vietnamese lunch around 2pm. We came back by 5pm to our hotel. Special thanks to our tour guide Van who was very fluent with her communication as well as knowledge about the tour . She made our tour easy and memorable one. Thank you Van for everything. Thank you adventure tour for organizing the wonderful and informative tour.This was my 3rd Vietnam tour in the last 7 months and i will definitely come back.

We had the best tour guide ever. JOSEPH (JOE), in all my travelling,  never come across such a helpful, caring, understand guide. Very accommodative and cheerful.  From beginning to the tiring end. We were 5 of us and another good soul old age but very energetic couple. We did Cu Chi Minh tunnel. history + once in a life time firing experience M60, M16, AK47.
Then the Mekong Delta where much fun awaited.  Detour, The egg shell art/craft, that too in aid of the handicapped was beautiful and well articulated, and we totally loved it.
Totally in love with all the creativity of the full package
If you are in Ho Chi Minh, this is a must tour. Cu Chi Minh tunnel and Mekong Delta.  The package is comparatively reasonable and worth every penny.
Our guide killed it. Thank you seem not enough
May God bless you Joe and all your wonderful team 🙏

We were at the cu chi tunnels with General Tuan and Tuan is an ex general of the Vietnam war, so hearing his side of the story was very inspiring and real. Thanks to him who made the trip wonderful and worth every penny

I highly recommend doing the half day Cu Chi tunnel with this company. We went on the normal tour and it was a great experience . Our guide , Viet, was really good at what he does. Funny, professional, he knew slang from every nationally on board! The lunch spot was awesome too.

data.formatted_address: Tầng 8, 225 Đ. Nguyễn Xí, P. 13, Bình Thạnh, Hồ Chí Minh 700000, Vietnam
data.name: Saigon Kiss Tours - Motorbike City & Food Tour with 100% Female Drivers

reviews.text: Ly the tour guide was fantastic. She emailed me to introduce herself and explain the tour . The scooter ride was very exhilarating as Ly was a good driver who made me feel safe . It was nice to experience the very busy traffic in Saigon. The food choices were outstanding, very tasty, filling and culturally a diverse selection of Vietnamese cuisine . I enjoyed every food choice and actually wanted more 😁. The visit to the pier at night was awesome with flattering views of Saigon by night . It was a nice ending to a Terrific tour . Ly was very professional, helpful , courteous, engaging and very informative. This tour is the best and I would highly recommend it with tour guide Ly.❤️

Saigon Kiss Tours were incredible. They made us feel so safe and comfortable when driving around.

Our drivers Jessie and Esther were AMAZING! They were so friendly and they just felt like our friends showing us the city.

The food was great - so tasty. The tour allowed us to try some foods that we would maybe never have tried if we were on our own.

Could not recommend this tour enough for when you are in Ho Chi Minh City.

Thanks again to Kiss Tours for the amazing memories we will cherish forever.

Rachael & Craig

Excellent trip. These girls are knowledgeable and great bike riders (feel so safe despite the scary traffic). The tour program covers 5 locations including meals. Highly recommend this to anyone who’s visiting this city.

What a great way to end our trip to Vietnam. We had an amazing time on the night tour with Hani and team. 6 of us scootered around HCMC like locals going to areas that as a normal tourist would never had found. The girls that took us on the journey were so nice and happy they just made the whole experience, chatting and laughing telling us about the history, culture and current events. I would recommend this to anybody. 4 of the 6 in our group where a little scared about the scooter experience but soon changed their minds and loved it. Super safe an awesome night with just the right amount of food. Kiss Saigon 💋 Thank you

We booked a Saigon by night scooter tour with female drivers through Kiss Tours.  And what a wonderful tour this was!  Our four beautiful tour guides were fantastic. The took our family safely around the city to have great food and see the places you would not normally see. They even got a birthday cake for my daughter. What a wonderful touch. If you only do one tour in Ho Chi Minh City, then this is the one. Thoroughly recommended. Thanks to Lime, Kate, Lisa and Sylvia for a safe and fantastic evening.

data.formatted_address: 9th floor, Vietcomreal Building, 68 Nguyen Hue street, Ben Nghe ward, Bến Nghé, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh 700000, Vietnam
data.name: Lost in Saigon - Hidden City and Food Tour

reviews.text: Long and Hui were very professional and knowledgeable tour guides. I felt very safe during the moped ride. My favorite parts of the tour was when they brought me and my boyfriend to an excellent coffee shop that was run by three Vietnamese sisters, and to a really good noodle place. Long and Hui were also good English conversationalists. Long was also prompt and proactive because he messaged me via Viber regarding the pickup time, and gave good recommendations about places to go in Vietnam. Also, when it rained, they provided a poncho to keep us dry. The tour was intimate and fun. Thumbs up!

This is one of the best trip I have taken in Vietnam. They really know good places in the city, which can hardly found by the tourists like us. They can also spoke really good english and helped us have better understand about the city, the differences between the North and the South region of Vietnam. I highly recommended their tour to everyone who's reading this.

We booked a food tour 24 hours in advance. We received a booking confirmation by email.

On the day, no one turned up. We called the office and we were told our tour was cancelled.

Extremely poor service. Do not recommend.

The best tour you can do. Although we booked at relatively short notice and it was the time of the Chinese New Year, our guides Tom and Red were able to take us to great places.
As we already had some experience with Vietnamese food, we were able to make personal wishes before the tour started.

The best tour we've ever been on!

We try to find unusual tours wherever we go, but this one is the best so far!

Sang and his team are lovely, the food is amazing, and you get to see a peice of the real Saigon.

Don't over think it, just go for it :)

data.formatted_address: 502/11/22, Huỳnh Tấn Phát, Bình Thuận, Quận 7, Hồ Chí Minh 70000, Vietnam
data.name: Xin Chao Private Vietnam Tours | Best Attractions, Family Adventure, Food & Guided Private Tour in Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam

reviews.text: The Brunner (family of 4 )went with Xin Chao private tours because of the 5 star reviews. We got a 6 star tour. Loc was absolutely amazing. Every choice he recommended was fantastic -street food/tailor made clothing /hotels/sites were beyond exceptional. We did 10 days with Loc where he took care of everything. I did not know Vietnam was a foodie town where you eat with your eyes before your mouth. I did not know I would fall in love with the people and the level of personal service you get. Americans can live like kings there making it a little tough to come back. I would recommend this tour emphatically.

Our tour with Lo Lo across Vietnam was nothing short of incredible. From the bustling streets of Saigon to the historic charm of Hue, Danang’s scenic beauty, the quaintness of Ho An, and the vibrant culture of Hanoi, Lo Lo guided us through each destination with immense knowledge and enthusiasm. His ability to explain the rich history and respond to all our queries was remarkable, especially considering my limited Vietnamese - thankfully, his English was excellent!

Lo Lo transformed our vacation into a truly memorable journey. By the end of our trip, he wasn’t just our guide; he felt like part of our family. We highly recommend Lo Lo for anyone looking to explore Vietnam in a friendly, informative, and unforgettable way.”

I went to Vietnam on a tour. It was great! The guide was nice, and I saw beautiful places and tried yummy food. I learned a lot about Vietnam's culture. I recommend Xin Chao tours to everyone visiting vietnam!

My husband and I used this company for a 2 week private tour of Vietnam from Ho Chi Minh City all the way to Hanoi and beyond. It was an unforgettable experience that was surprisingly affordable. We learned about Loc and his tour company through friends who had booked a similar tour a couple of years prior.

Every detail was taken care of. The only thing we had to do was book our flight to Vietnam and Loc took care of all the rest. His company booked all of our hotels, tours, intra-country flights and drivers. He was even waiting for us at the airport when we arrived. We experienced things we never would have found on our own. We went to restaurants that didn't have a single westerner in them; we had lunch at a restaurant in someone's backyard in the Mekong delta; we went to a small fish market in central Vietnam where we watched fish being bought right from the boat.

We booked the mid-tier package so we were shocked at how nice all of the hotels were. They all had large, modern and comfortable rooms with excellent AC. We had a motorbike tour to 4 different restaurants in Ho Chi Minh, a country-side motorbike tour in Hoi An, saw countless temples and pagodas, hiked through the jungle, and even did an overnight cruise in Halong Bay. We had many encounters with locals thanks to Loc. He knew that our goal was to experience the culture so that's how he targeted our tour. He will customize each tour according to your preferences.

I really do want to emphasize that this tour was surprisingly reasonably priced. We encountered a group taking a bus tour that followed the same basic path as our tour. Their tour was two days shorter and most of the excursions were "extra". The base cost of that tour was the same price as our longer, all inclusive private tour.

Book any tour that Xin Chao Private Vietnam Tours offers. Each tour is meticulously planned and executed. You will not find a better tour operator.

A big thank you to Loc and the team for organising our tours in Ho Chi Minh. The foodie / scooter tour was amazing, a real highlight of our trip.  The tour guides were so friendly and welcoming, and we felt so comfortable with them on the motorbikes.  We had such fun exploring the city and eating some amazing street food.  Our kids really loved the experience and are still talking about it.  Anne, our tour guide for all three tours, was so kind, knowledgeable and friendly.  She had everything organised and accommodated all our questions and requests.  We can highly recommend the foodie scooter tour, the Mekong Delta tour and the tour to the Chu Chi tunnels.  Thank yo Loc and your team for a very memorable experience.  We hope to visit again.

data.formatted_address: 41/66 Cầu Xây, Phường Tân Phú, Quận 9, Hồ Chí Minh 70000, Vietnam
data.name: Hoa Viet Garden

reviews.text:
Beautiful scenery, many beautiful shooting angles. My family went around 4pm to ease the sun.
The campus is large and many other items are being set up. Additional play area for children.
The animals are very cute and friendly..my baby loves it.😊
There is a separate camping and BBQ area for families or groups. There is a campfire area…
I went at a time when there weren't many flowers, the flowers had already bloomed.
In general, it is suitable for children to run around and jump with animals in the Farm.
Fast food and drinks are fully served. The price is okay for a sightseeing and tourist area.

Visitors need to be aware of general hygiene when taking photos. Because I saw a lot of water glasses, nylon wrap, plastic food boxes... scattered all over the place to take pictures, rest areas... 😔😔😔 The management should arrange to have an employee regularly go around to collect trash. This will make your tourist area very clean and you need to add more general cleanliness signs to remind visitors when they visit.

Adult ticket price 50K/person, motorbike parking 5k, car 15k.
Each person has their own way of viewing and evaluating. My assessment is based on personal opinion and my family's experience.

Hazzzz . After buying tickets and water, the staff forgot to give me water. If you want to remove ice, put a little tea in the bottom of the glass.
. Looks wild. Before it was completed, the shop opened. Not thoughtful
. Animals are very shy and run away when they see people
. The wilderness doesn't look fresh, the trees aren't green
. Entering the gate, the sign in front tells you to turn left. But turn right :)))
. Park your car carelessly. Very shaky and loose....
. In general, when you come, take note that taking pictures is a bit difficult because the animals are scared and can only run like horses.
. All these examples are just propaganda, but the desolation is scary
. Come once, don't come twice
Cool, can let children play with goats, sheep, horses, rabbits, and ducks.

Ticket price is 50k/person. Seeing the animals is completely worth going out 🐑🐎🐇🐐👍
Remember to wear a jacket and an umbrella because the weather will be a bit sunny

The day I went was quite sunny around noon. It was new so the plants weren't big yet, the flowers weren't growing yet, the landscape was sparse and I couldn't take many pictures, the animals were cute, the service was ok, the price for a bunch of grass was 10k to feed them diligently.

data.formatted_address: 314, 336 Hai Bà Trưng, Phường Tân Định, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam
data.name: Tan Dinh Market

reviews.text:
Right, so I’m wandering around Saigon & stumble into this market—what a place! It’s like a sensory overload of the best kind.

Imagine this: I’m just minding my own business, looking at some fruit, when this cheeky old woman practically grabs my arm and thrusts a spoonful of her homemade chili paste at me. Now, I’m thinking, “Oh, this is going to be a disaster.” But no, it’s actually amazing—spicy enough to make me question my life choices, but brilliant.

I end up chatting with her for a while, and she’s laughing like she’s just told the world’s best joke. Next thing I know, I’m leaving with a jar of chili paste and a smile on my face.

This place isn’t just a market; it’s a full-on experience. It’s chaotic, it’s vibrant, and it’s exactly the kind of place where you’ll get an unexpected story—or in my case, a jar of chili paste and a new friend.

A nice market. Has the Pink church, highlands coffee where we sat for a bit, some showrooms, cycle market etc. lit if traffic though. I went to look for water but couldn’t get it anywhere. There was only one cafe kinda where she gave me 500 no of water for 80000 vnd normal regular water and cold referigated water for 100000 vnd which is expensive but then it’s all about need. Almost like double price. Language problem too. I went to a grocery store cum small restaurant and they couldn’t understand English. It’s in district 1 itself.

This market offers a more authentic local experience compared to Ben Thanh Market. Although it has fewer stalls, prices are significantly lower.

It's a clean and tidy market where many items have prices clearly displayed, eliminating the need for bargaining. It's advisable to have Google Translate handy as English isn't widely spoken among the vendors.

Came on a Saturday morning and it was well packed with locals buying food, produce, meat, etc. Remember to drop by the pink church for some photos!
Quang Nam Festival Any exhibitors from  Tam Key, Da Nang and Hoi An? 3 day festival

Most of the shops in Tan Binh primarily cater to wholesalers, although they do offer retail options at a slightly higher price. I enjoy visiting this area whenever I'm in Vietnam because it's not overly touristy and offers a wide range of dress and clothing options in various qualities and styles. There's also an excellent bridal selection available. The food court serves delicious spicy noodle soup, rice plates, and Bun Rieu noodle soup. It's a laid-back atmosphere and enjoyable to wander around, with fewer vendors bothering you compared to Ben Thanh Market.

data.formatted_address: 19 Hoàng Hoa Thám, Phường 13, Tân Bình, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam
data.name: Hoang Hoa Tham Market

reviews.text:
A market where the locals go to buy groceries and eat. There is fresh fish,  fruits, meat, spices on sale. There are also new clothes, second-hand clothes, new shoes, reject shoes, sandals and slippers on sale.

I tried the Banh Flan and it was excellent. The fresh coconut water went for VD$15k (about US$0.65). Cheap!
Crowded but not very tidy
Old, but wide selection for clothes with reasonable prices.

Love the sin to stall on the street!
Awesome durian sin to and avocado sin to!!!!

A very well stocked market, traditional, typical Vietnamese, charming and with friendly people who serve you with kindness and disposition looking to place their products in your preference. Wonderful indeed

data.formatted_address: QM8Q+QJF, Đ. Cống Quỳnh, Phường Phạm Ngũ Lão, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam
data.name: Thái Bình Market

reviews.text: You should come here for breakfast! You can seat anywhere and order from any shop! Huge range of authentic Vietnamese food to choose from. Prices are also affordable here.

mbarking on a gastronomic journey across different districts and numerous locales, my quest for the ultimate BBQ pork ball and pork vermicelli has finally met its match here at Thai Minh Market. This hidden gem transcends ordinary culinary expectations, making it a destination that pork enthusiasts cannot afford to miss.

The pork vermicelli, a masterpiece in its own right, stands out with its flawlessly soft texture—a rare find compared to the often dry and semi-soft alternatives encountered in my culinary travels. It's clear that the chefs here have mastered the art of achieving the perfect balance, elevating the dining experience to new heights.

However, the true star of the show is undeniably the pork ball— a culinary symphony in every bite. Juicy, flavorful, and expertly crafted, it has rightfully earned its status as a signature dish. It's no surprise that patrons flock to Thai Minh Market specifically for this delectable creation.

The ambiance of the market, coupled with the tantalizing aroma wafting from the stalls, creates an inviting atmosphere that enhances the overall dining experience. The dedication to quality and the evident passion for their craft set Thai Minh Market apart, making it a standout destination for discerning food enthusiasts.

In conclusion, if you're a connoisseur of pork-based delights and crave an experience that transcends the ordinary, Thai Minh Market is the haven you've been searching for. Prepare to be captivated by the exceptional BBQ pork ball and pork vermicelli—a culinary journey that promises satisfaction with every mouthful.

A true local Vietnamese market, to experience the local life.
The food here is good and cheap and there is a variety. As it is a local market, they don't speak English, so just point and order the food unless you have dietary restrictions, then don't order the food here.
Don't give 500k dong note as they don't have the change. Maximum to use is 100k dong note.

Surprisingly Great food. Tasted bun thit nuong, mi quang and banh cuon nong, hu tiew nam vang. All are excellent! Four different stalls.more importantly, the prices are already well stated so they wouldn't scam tourist. This place is frequented by the locals..

Market was near our hotel so we came for the bun thit nuong. Rice noodles topped with bbq-ed meatball & pork and fried spring roll. Everything was so delicious! I wished we found this place sooner - I would love to have re-visited. Very affordable at 35k a bowl.

data.formatted_address: Nguyễn Văn Hưởng, Thảo Điền, Quận 2, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam
data.name: Thao Dien Market

reviews.text: On google it says 24 hr open but I am not sure if it’s correct or not . I got there around 13:30 but it’s pretty dead at that time and not so clear on first floor so I didn’t continue explore further.around the market there are many vendors selling fruit. Normally I would love to go to local market to at least eat something but unfortunately I couldnt get anything from this market
Nice. They have a stage show at night and the river is just around the corner.

The pool is located on 4th floor of Thao Dien Pearl. It is so clean and the environment is so nice. It is not crowded so you could swim comfortably. There are options of paying daily or monthly with reasonable price. On average, you pay just around 30,000VND for a day. I would recommemd swimming here.

The market is fine with standard Vietnamese market faire (fresh produce, various cuts of meat, poultry, fish, etc.). However, I usually come here at night for street food. There's a fantastic BBQ duck place across from the riverside that can't be missed. They also make their own rice wine, which gets the night going well!!
Everything fresh and at good price. U can get  fresh coconut powder from a coconut shop outside.

data.formatted_address: 34, 36 Đ. An Dương Vương, Phường 9, Quận 5, Hồ Chí Minh 700000, Vietnam
data.name: An Dong Market

reviews.text:
I had a memorable experience during my visit to An Dong Market (Chợ An Đông), which left a lasting impression on me. One of the aspects I really appreciated about the market was its excellent air conditioning.

As I stepped into the bustling market, I was greeted by a cool and refreshing atmosphere, a stark contrast to the heat and humidity outside. The air conditioning made browsing through the various stalls and shops a comfortable experience, allowing me to take my time exploring without feeling overheated or fatigued.

The market itself is a vibrant hub of activity, offering a wide array of goods ranging from clothing and accessories to electronics, home goods, and traditional Vietnamese crafts. Navigating through the aisles, I was captivated by the colorful displays and the diverse range of products available.

One of the highlights of my visit was discovering unique handicrafts and souvenirs that showcased the rich cultural heritage of Vietnam. The market's diverse offerings catered to both locals and tourists, making it a popular destination for shopping and experiencing the local culture.

In addition to the shopping opportunities, An Dong Market also boasts a food court where visitors can sample a variety of delicious Vietnamese dishes and snacks. After a satisfying shopping spree, I enjoyed indulging in some local delicacies while soaking in the lively atmosphere of the market.

While there is much wholesale in and around this market, there’s plenty of bargains to be had…and it’s airconditioned. Note also the surrounding shops outside. It’s about a $5 Grab ride from District 1 and worth the trip. There are ATMs around but cash is preferred. There’s authentic food available.
Prices are definitely cheaper than Ben Thanh Market. Basement selling different types of nuts and coffee, even dried seafood products. Recommended to visit when in Saigon

Better place than Ben Than to go shopping for all kind of things. A little bit cheaper and less touristy. Plus it ist nicely air conditioned, not too strong.

Best place for me to get a tailored Ao Dai! You can choose beautiful fabrics from one of the many stalls. After choosing they will call a tailor right away to do all the measurement. The dress can be picked up within 2-3 days or 24h. It is even possible to get things done within 3h! (for a higher price ofc).

Been to An Dong Market many times, mainly just to buy some coffee beans, dried fruits, nuts and some dried seafood, like sea cucumbers, dried shrimp, etc. Compared to Singapore,  it is definitely much cheaper. Most of the sellers can speak Cantonese or Mandarin so it makes things much easier. Our gang of Singaporeans always go to one shop called Phung Thanh 凤成.

This was the first time I had my lunch here, the Pho was just so so but the fresh Sour Sop juice was very nice and refreshing.

data.formatted_address: QPC3+Q6H, Tôn Thất Đạm, Street, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh 700000, Vietnam
data.name: Chợ Cũ Tôn Thất Đạm

reviews.text:
Only of the original markets in the city. It still has that same original / authentic charm and feel.
It’s just a short 200m street but it’s bustling and feels authentic.
It’s not far from the Saigon Center mall so easy to visit.
The area is changing so not sure how much longer this market will survive. There are several very cool hidden bars popping up, and the winner of “best restaurant in Vietnam” is located on this market street too (Restaurant Anan).

Even they call it old market but you can find lots of interesting things, as a photographer, and as a tourist, to discover. The road is filled with lots of stalls and food, both sides, where you can enjoy the local food (springrolls, noodle, milktea, ...), and where you can take lots of nice photo of a local life~
1 block long market with food, groceries, meat, and liquor. Cool to knock around if you're at nearby Saigon Square or Nguyen Hue.

Ton That Dam street is located in the heart of district 1 Sai Gon but there are so many market stalls that very dirty and ugly looking 👎 This adversely affected the urban landscape of the center of Saigon !!!
hidden bar inside the old market , one of the most oldest quater of our city

data.formatted_address: 123 Phan Đình Phùng, Phường 17, Phú Nhuận, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam
data.name: Phu Nhuan Market

reviews.text: Local market, good price, not too much stuff but ok
I didn't know there is a whole small area next to the market where we can have food, buy things, drink milk/ tea and enjoy the busy life of Vietnamese market. I love it!
Fairly large market.
Its not an official market but its quite good and complete. Some vendor provide halal food because the Market is inside moslem community.
The market is full of various goods and service with reasonable price. Food served here is excellent.

data.formatted_address: 134 Đ. Nam Kỳ Khởi Nghĩa, Bến Nghé, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam
data.name: Bến Nghé Street Food

reviews.text: Amazing place!!! So much food variety, it's possible to get simply everything you might want it even dreamed of. Very colorful, a lot of people and life around. Quite well organized for the street food market, tables a getting cleaned very fast and service team even giving you a napkins if you forgot. I was really surprised. Definitely must visit place in Ho Chi Min 👍

Very nice collection of street food carts, so many different dishes to choose from! It was nice and clean and life music in the evening. It's not as crowded in the afternoon and doesn't take long until you get your dish. I absolutely adored the vegetarian restaurant where they re-created BBQ spets and ribs from tofu and seitan. Never had anything tasting so much like pork belly before! Absolute recommendation for vegans :)

A large variety of delicious food, and catered especially to tourists. There's something here for everyone – Vietnamese food with a modern spin is also available. The prices can also be higher given the location, but not exorbitant. Worth a visit if you're new to the city.

Really enjoyable way to sample some street food type fare. It's clean, easy to order - you buy at the stall, they give you a beeper. Tables at the back are cleared and cleaned regularly. Here are big fans to circulate air.

What a fun place Ben Nghe Night Street Food Markets are. A big bundle of street vendors with every type of food, freshly prepared and served. Beer, cocktails, music and lots of fun through the night. This is a must visit experience in Ho Chi Min city. Thoroughly good value and excellent quality.

Most items are 15K/100g and the owner is friendly and speaks good English.  There's also a fresh coconut vendor inside as well.  If you're hungry this isn't the place to visit for a meal.

reviews.text: So much quieter than Ben Thanh markets, better quality too. Air conditioned indoor market with mainly cool weather clothing (jackets, coats etc). We were looking specifically for knock off north face pants. We came to the right place. We ended up purchasing several shirts, 2 pants, and 2 jackets at good prices. The sales people are willing to negotiate.

For an afternoon indoors - this is a great option when in Ho Chi Minh City.

For more adventures follow us on YouTube @eyecool

I highly recommend A10-12 at ground floor. The lady speaks english, provied good offer and friendly.

The price is a bit higher than other local markets but the ambience and the feeling it brings is quite comfortable and energetic to me.
The architecture of the neighborhood makes me feel relaxing as well.

reviews.text: Mostly military clothings and goods are available here. I also saw some of the traditional clothings.

Decent place if you want to buy Vietnam War memorabilia.

It's difficult to get anything that's real but there are plenty of copies.

Make sure to verify when you're buying items that are being sold as real.

Cool market, a lot of hardware stores and surplus 'style' clothing. Most of the military surplus stuff is reproduction, although if you hunt, you can find some genuine gear.

I bought an old VHF radio, but this is not Vietnam war vintage, it is of Isreali design made in 1985 probably in Singapore. I bought it because I thought it was cool rather than worrying about its origin. ~$45 US - worth it just for its gadgetness.

Also bought a cool pair of military 'flight' suit type pants that I have not seen anywhere else. Could be from anywhere. ~$20 US. Had to bargain, with prices only reduced to about 2/3 origial price after walking away and not being too keen.

As long as you are aware that this is just a market selling gear from all over the world, (some new) it's a cool market that is worth a visit.
If you are military fans... you should visit it... offering military stuffs.

This place was excellent for finding old military stuff such as medals jackets and helmets. Be sure to walk and see all shops before choosing just one as they are very competitive for price and will do you good rates, also be sure to really look at the objects as it’s a mix between real and fakes. I got the objects as seen below.

I wouldn't recommend it as a normal tourist attraction, but anyone living in HCMC should go there at least once.

data.name: Tran Hung Dao Statue

reviews.text:
A busy roundabout on the main walking promenade in Saigon.
Difficult to cross but nevertheless my favourite part of the city amongst the greens.
Bustles in the evenings with locals who come here to enjoy drinks and family time together.

Large statue on a roundabout beside the river set in beautiful, well-kept gardens. As always in Vietnam, crossing the road is a difficult prospect, especially when it's UP a roundabout and traffic is coming from all different directions at you.
Once you've passed safely, you're greeted by a well-kept green space and a statue of Tran Hung Dao set at the edge of the fountain with a pond. Although the fountain was not during my visit.
The area is beautiful and just a short walk across the street to the Harbor Garden is the boardwalk next to the river.

Nice statue yes. But is it worth crossing the crazy road just to see the statue? Maybe not. Just look at the pictures I post. Good enough. Unless you want to experience walking through 1000000 motorcycles and car then sure. Pro tip: walk beside a local when crossing the road.
Nice big statue in a large  traffic island

Trần Hưng Đạo (1228–1300) was the Supreme Commander/ Grand Prince / statesman of Vietnam during the Trần Dynasty. Figure of almost legendary proportions in Vietnamese history, a brilliant military strategist. After his death, he was considered a saint and deified by the people and named Đức Thánh Trần (God Trần).

Born Prince Trần Quốc Tuấn, he commanded the Đại Việt armies that repelled three major Mongol invasions in the 13th century. His triple victories over the mighty Mongol Yuan Dynasty under Kublai Khan are considered among the greatest military feats in world history. General Trần Hưng Đạo’s military brilliance and prowess are reflected in many warfare treatises that he authored. Trần Hưng Đạo is regarded as one of the most accomplished military tacticians in history.

reviews.text:
About 2 months ago I visited Jun's new address for the first time.
The shop sells many types of plants. That day I bought 1 fragrant pine tree, 1 woody lavender tree and 1 chrysanthemum tree.
Currently, my chrysanthemum is unfortunately dead. As for the fragrant pine tree, it's still good, the lavender tree is difficult to grow, but it's still very good for stealing (stealing, stealing, stealing :v).
Below is a picture of it when I first bought it and a picture of it after 2 months (lavender grew so thickly that I just trimmed it):
The tree is so beautiful 😍😍 and the staff is enthusiastic and cute

This is one of my favorite places to buy aromatic spices. The garden has many types and is updated regularly. The garden is available on shoppe or online store. I often buy online, because I'm close to the store. I have to say, walking up to the store is a bit tiring, but once I get there, I'm not tired anymore. There are many types of plants that are lush and very fragrant. Although this is not the cheapest place, I believe that the quality and service here will be worth every penny spent by everyone. Everyone keeps trying again and again.
Fresh, healthy, beautiful plants, cute accessories, very carefully packaged, meeting the shop owner who gave me advice was very enthusiastic and cute. Will definitely buy again!
The shop is a bit small but the prices are cheap and the staff are enthusiastic.

data.name: Laws For Paws Vietnam

reviews.text:
An incredible team working to help dogs in Vietnam. Offering volunteer opportunities, adoption programs, increasing public awareness and education for the younger generation.
I’ve had the pleasure to meet Zoe, a rescued husky, badly handled prior to arrival at the shelter and Laws For Paws have done an amazing job, with proper standards, due diligence and such care!
This is one of the only local charity/shelter organizations that operates in accordance with high standards and proper veterinary care. All adoptions are done after dogs are sterilized and proper forms have been filled out by adopters.
A very well maintained shelter space and just amazing team work! Thank you for doing your best and helping dogs!

If it wasn't for this organization, this little guy would'nt have survived.

We were very lucky to encounter Laws For Paws! We found Olaf, a little puppy at the beach who was in a very bad condition.
Against the odds he pulled through. Elizabeth and her team took care of him. We saw him transform in a happy little dog and fell in love with him! So did Laws For Paws. Above all this they made it possible for us to adopt him and bring him to Belgium. We're forever grateful!

Whenever you see a dog in need, please don't turn away. There's always something you can do. Laws for Paws is a true inspiration and makes me believe in a better future for the dogs in Vietnam.

You can always support them with funds or volunteer work. They truly deserve all the support they can get.

Laws for paws is amazing! They have helped and looked after the did Muc and her 5 puppies while they grew up. 4 of the pups were adopted to loving homes and Muc is taken good care of. All the dogs are so lucky to be there. They get love, attention, trying and daily walks! Thank you so much!

There’s so much to say about Laws For Paws, Elisabeth and all helpers as they are just Angels in whatever they are doing for all the dogs in and around Ho Chi Minh City. We could not have been happier with how they have been treated our beloved Dog Diddy, who was rescued from the streets of Saigon with his 8 other siblings and his mum. If you are looking for a furry friend they are by far the best and most carrying as well as professional.

Laws for Paws is the most professional dog shelter in HCMC! Elizabeth and her team are amazing and very accommodating. They have been rescuing so many dogs for years then help them be ready to their forever home.

If you and someone you know is looking for a fur baby, this is your place. Laws for Paws will help you find the right match and always be helpful to make sure the adoption goes well!

I fully support their amazing work and absolutely recommend them!

data.formatted_address: Long Hòa, Cần Giờ, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
data.name: Monkey Island

reviews.text:
Good for people who want to explore local history and nature. About 1 hour by driving from Ho Chi Minh city.

The weather is extremely hot, thus recommend to using electric car to commute from main gate to visiting area (about 1km). You van buy tickets at the gate (reservation is not necessary). You should bring a lot a water and personal fan. Be careful with your snack and belongings since the monkeys there is quite aggressive.

This was a memorable place to visit while in Vietnam. The monkeys are everywhere (except the crocodile pen). The monkeys here reeeeeaaaallly like ice cream. If you walk anywhere with some, they’re going to snatch it. Rumor has it that ice cream can be traded to get back your sunglasses (which they love), hats (which they love), phones (which they love), or any other physical object (which YOU love). Leave as much as you can in the car, bus, or people movers. Rangers can often get stuff back for you, but sometimes they’re just not there when it happens.

Some tour guides liked to carry sticks to fend off the monkeys, but aided by our tour guide, we were wisely told that if a monkey does approach you or jump on you, try not to freak out. They are most interested in what they can steal off of you (don’t have it on you in the first place) and they just want to smell you and see what you’re all about.
Beware - lots of monkeys. Keep your belongings safe. A nice walk and the visit to the war settlement is worthwhile.

Very beautiful UNESCO listed Mangrove Forest.
It takes about 2-3 hours to walk around the place, and the forest is very pretty, and you can meet and take photos of a bunch of wild monkies.
There are 2 populations of wild monkies, be careful of the brown/longtailed ones, they will steal your stuff, especially glasses, and ransom them for food. Do not eat or drink in front of them. The yellow/short tailed ones are much more well behaved.
The facilities are a bit rudimentary, but are functional. Some of the bridges and walkways are rickety, so watch your footing/weight distribution.
There is a replica NVA Guerilla camp with raised walkways which have been added for your convenience. The camp gives some history to the fighters that lived in the area, and an idea of their living conditions.
Overall, I think it's worthwhile to visit.

BRITISH SCOOTER DAY TRIP VISIT - We wanted to do a day trip from the city on our scooter. This park is 221,000d when accounting for the extra fees (for two people). We were so worried about being attacked, we planned accordingly. Long trousers and no bling. We were very cautious and had no issues with the monkeys. We did however see other guests be harassed. Bring absolutely nothing and you will be ok! The park was very empty and run down, we only stayed for around 20 mins. That being said, when accounting for the scooter ferry and long ride through the countryside it was well worth the day trip! Would recommend.

reviews.text: Not a lot of birds, but the walking, exploring and interconnected nature of the delta is stunning! I tasted 9 different species of coconuts, took a boat ride into the river to explore the fruits growing along the river’s edge and ate a delicious meal stacked with vegetables. Incredible experience! P

Not many birds, I spent hours driving from Saigon to get here by 4:30 pm. Being advised to get here from 4 to 6 pm is good time when birds returning. However, I only heard some songs and there were nothing else but silence.
Some nice flowers and huts are the make up for long drive.

Very friendly staff, the forest is beautiful but don’t expect to see much birds :/
I would have love to try the water activities!
Very interesting place. Not many birds, but the forest is tremendous.

Not a major sight. Go in during the season or at least during evenings to sight any birds at all. Just a decent places with few trees and a restaurant. You have the option to stay in the premises as well.

data.formatted_address: 875 Đ. Cách Mạng Tháng 8, Phường 15, Quận 10, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam
data.name: White Rabbit Amusement Park

reviews.text: Fun, children-friendly. The Jump Arena is good for both children and adult. You can buy 30mins, 1hour or 2 hour (30 mins is enough)
The children love swimming here. It is a big pool to have your exercise. The water is clean and the toilet or wash area is clean.
Well the shooting range was great, it's an okay place but dirty.
Tho Trang park or Le Thi Rieng park is located in center of district 10. Parents can pick childrens come here for relaxing and playing.

This is located inside Lê Thị Riêng park, where you have to park your bikes to get in. I'm not sure where to park cars, but if you go by bike, then there are:
1. Main parking area: on front gate, cách mạng tháng 8 strery => heavy traffic
2. 2nd parking: side gate, Trường Sơn street => less traffic from that direction approach.
Price per bike: 5000vnd

In the park, if you want to play games, there are stations where you can check and buy tickets for all the games .

data.formatted_address: GV29+F2W, An Thới Đông, Cần Giờ, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
data.name: Ban Quản Lý Rừng Phòng Hộ Cần Giờ

reviews.text: Mangrove forest with river near the sea; a lot of birds are living here. CLean air; quiet. It is amazing to visit.

Beautiful mangrove walkways. Very quiet. Free entry. Spartan cafes and facilities with a very dilapidated vibe. Perfect for me, looking for birds and wildlife.

Some good birds, lots of collared kingfisher, indian white-eye, mangrove whistler, gorygone. Monkeys about. A lot of mosquitos. Some crazy mud skippers down by the river.

A mangrove forest sanctuary. There seemed to be some information and exhibits in Vietnamese but I could really work it out. Lots of school kids were on a trip. Free entrance, nice walkway through mangroves. Lots of monkeys and pigs, cafe and restaurant etc.
Not a great deal to see along this road. But you can walk into the mangroves along a path, see some monkeys and climb an observation tower
Overall they are kind, helpful, hospitable. It was dirty as I expected. There are only trees so it will be boring to play.

data.formatted_address: Phong NHA, Bố Trạch District, Quang Binh Province, Vietnam
data.name: Rescue center, conservation and development of organisms

reviews.text: Small area but already few species are present. If you come here with Hai eco tour you will have a great and touching introduction on this rescue center's history
Ok
Good
Very interesting experience, bird watching, animal watching, stream bathing, mountain climbing, waterfall skiing
A place to care for and rescue wild animals and rare plants

data.formatted_address: 16 Nguyễn Đình Chiểu, Đa Kao, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh 700000, Vietnam
data.name: WILDTOUR Co.,LTD

reviews.text: We (a group of 11 swedish birders) had a great birdingtour with WILDTOUR in Vietnam in nov last year! We birded from Tam Dao NP in the north to Cat Tien NP in the south during almost 3 weeks. Many thanks to our professional birdguides Bao Nguyen and Quang Nguyen, who made this trip an unforgettable experience for life. Their great knowledge of the birds and nature of Vietnam was a solid guarantee for our success. In a very personal and kind manner they introduced us to many of the rare birds so hard to find if your are on your own. I can warmly recommend WILDTOUR as your birdingpartner in Vietnam!

I joined WildTour a birding trip to China, one to Can Gio and Go Cong for shorebirds, and several trips to Cat Tien National Parks. All are great experience. Unlike other birdguides, as a biologist, Bao is very knowledgeable about birds and conservation policies in Vietnam and other countries in the region. His knowledge and humour make the tour supper interesting and enjoyable. Highly recommended.
the best choice for birding in Vietnam, don't hesitate to contact them if you are looking for a professional bird guide with good service.

data.formatted_address: 456/1 Đ. Hậu Giang, Phường 12, Quận 6, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam
data.name: Trạm Cứu Hộ Chó Mèo SaiGonTime

reviews.text: It was a mistake to bring it here
Love you guys
Wow

data.formatted_address: Hồ Sơn, Tam Đảo District, Vĩnh Phúc, Vietnam
data.name: Tam Dao Bear Rescue Center

reviews.text:
Make a reservation! Had a lovely time. Kid friendly. Very knowledge staff and lots of bears to take a look at. Tour can be in Vietnamese or English. Tour lasts about an hour and fifteen minutes to an hour and a half.

Good to see the conservation efforts as well as the common reasons for saving the bears. They also help educating people on replacements for bear products.

Happy looking bears in a safe place, hopefully they all get well soon and return to the wild.
Thank you all of the staff for your amazing work

This is a rescue centre. Animals Asia is stopping bear bile farming in Vietnam. The bears come here to live out their lives peacefully. This is not a zoo,  you must book online for a tour on their open days.
It's a very educational place. I recommend knowing the place's meaning.
The staff were friendly and its a really worth while program. I had to physically restrain myself from cuddling the bears

data.formatted_address: 193A Lý Chính Thắng, Phường Võ Thị Sáu, Quận 3, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam
data.name: Thế Giới Cá Kiểng Ngọc Mai

reviews.text:
The store is right in front of Ly Chinh Thang street, very easy to find. You can buy fish and other decorative items here.

Right next to it are beef noodle shops, vermicelli noodles, noodle soup, and cafes, so it will be very interesting for a morning of shopping for fish, ornamental items, breakfast, and coffee.

Pleasant staff.

data.formatted_address: 266 Đ. Điện Biên Phủ, Phường 17, Bình Thạnh, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam
data.name: Meow House: Coworking, Cakes & Rescue Cat Cafe

reviews.text: Such a cute cat cafe with lovely staff. Drinks are amazing and reasonably priced. No entrance fee/petting cat fee is amazing, so worth it! The cats are so well behaved and have colour coded collars to let you know if they are safe to pet which was so helpful. Will visit again next time if I can!

I've been to this cafe before around New years last year, and there were so many kittens. When asked about them, I was happy to hear that the batch from last year were adopted fairly quickly after (yay!!!). It's one of the few cat cafés that visited where they have rescue animals (they even had a dog last year.) The drinks are delicious with freshly cut fruits in them and fairly priced. The cats are friendly and adorable. They also seem to be well taken care of. The workers are also friendly and don't force the animals to interact with customers when they don't want to. Overall, I would definitely come back and support the animals and cafe. Also adopt don't shop!!!!

The price is reasonable (pretty cheap for a pet cafe actually!!!) We ordered oolong ginger tea and Vietnamese milk coffee. The tea is okay but the coffee is absolutely good (there are vegan alternatives here). The cats are well-fed and know their space very well (they will ignore you if they want).
The drinks were delicious and reasonably priced, and the cats were adorable. They were all sleeping initially but became active after and were very friendly.
Coming here is a no brainer for cat lovers. You support an ethical business managed by well trained employees and the cats are so sweet, friendly and even playful.

data.formatted_address: 6 Đ. Lê Duẩn, Bến Nghé, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam
data.name: April 30th Park

reviews.text: A lot of trees, many people come and do picnics here especially young people. A very nice scene to view here as people go to socialize outdoors not just stay at home. It's a good culture that needs to be preserved as well as the place. Need more green parks like this in the middle of the city where people can just walk around.

April 30th Park, located in District 1 near major attractions like Notre-Dame Cathedral Basilica and the Reunification Palace, is named after the historic date marking the end of the Vietnam War. Though not a large park, it offers a pleasant patch of greenery with well-paved walking paths and park benches for some tranquility. It's not a major attraction but serves as a peaceful picnic spot and hangout for locals on weekends. There are some street food vendors, making it a nice spot for a bit of peace in the bustling city. Nothing amazing, but it provides a much-needed escape.

It is a beautiful park at the central of Ho Chi Minh City at District 1. It connects Independence Palace and Notre Dame Cathedral. It is withing walking distance to major tourist attractions. It can be a rest place for tourists upon visiting tourist sites or for locals to play and rest here.

Very good location, creating space for walking and enjoying nature in town.
They also have bicycle rental that you just need to download the app. There are many other bike station for you to return.
Give it a try
Very nice park with many tall trees.

data.formatted_address: Phường Nhà Mát, Bạc Liêu, Bac Lieu, Vietnam
data.name: Bạc Liêu Bird Sanctuary

reviews.text: The birds are mostly there between May and October. It is a breeding sanctuary for migrating birds. If you want to see birds it's best to go early morning 6am or an hour before sunset when they return to roost. I've been visiting the sanctuary for 8 years and have always found the staff to be helpful and knowledgeable. If you wear camouflage clothing they will give you a walking tour with a guide. The key word is sanctuary, they don't want hundreds of tourists walking around disturbing the chick's and nesting birds.

Oh it was great..close to city..there is a 5 level viewing platform to climb up and you can see birds but without a zoom you can’t really take pics..there were some birds in fenced areas but they are very shy..the ducks even were..over past the food area near the pond there is some pigs and two crocodiles
and some turtles..but look closely to see them..
There isn’t any guide or person around to tell you about the park but then there wasn’t anyone charging me to go in either so overall I can’t complain ..worth visiting if your in the area..

Don't go there. The bird sanctuary was probably no longer maintained during and after Corona. Furthermore, there are no official park employees anymore. The animals in the cages are neglected and the paths are overgrown. It was a sad sight.

nice location for birdwatching and photographers but battery car which brings you around is expensive (330.000)
When we ask walking they don't allow and also they is no bicycle.

When I arrived this place, there was no greeting signs and no introduction information about the place. I was stopped by some local people at a large gate being locked by them; they asked me to pay money to hire a shuttle bus in order to get inside, but were not willing to introduce to me what was behind the gate or answer my questions about their services. I was afraid of being ripped off; so I left.

data.formatted_address: Bù Gia Mập, Đồng Xoài, Binh Phuoc, Vietnam
data.name: Bu Gia Map National Park

reviews.text: Just 3 hrs drive from ho chi minh to BU GIA MAP, we was back to nature where we left our work, our phone, our busy life … outside of forest for 2 day 1. I had choosed HÀNH TRÌNH BU GIA MẬP who was organising the gruop tour, they did excellent job by  friendly guide- helpful porter- good cook team. I enjoyed so much.. it worth for package tour ( value for money) . I will back with them for another tour and will introduce to Al my friend who love trekking
Visit Bu Gia Map National Forest in the most beautiful time in the end of Apr, early May, when millions of butterfly migrate to somewhere secret deep inside the forest for mating season.

a very good place to visit and explore nature with friends or families... best place to unplug from technology... a beautiful forest/natural park... forest guides are friendly and experts in what they do... i’m just hoping that campers, hikers and visitors avoid throwing trash (candy and food wrappers) anywhere in the campsite and along the trail...

The forest near HCMCity. 2 days turn off mobile. We have chance to touch the real nature in Bu Gia Map forest. We see more the huge trees, listen deeply the waterfall, look at your friends's eye. We talk each others more in face to face, don't watch your FB, youtube and Netflix.
Appreciate the god, family to have me a chance to see beautiful world. Thankful

Amazing to live with the nature. Long ride from HCMC around 8 hours, but it is really worth for. You should go with the local tour guide here named Mr Giang, then you can enjoy the forest cusine and the very special experirment here.

data.formatted_address: 224, 226 Nguyễn Văn Hưởng, Thảo Điền, Thủ Đức, Hồ Chí Minh 71107, Vietnam
data.name: Animal Doctors International Hospital

reviews.text:
We tried a bunch of other vets in the area and we had lots of problems, such as lack of transparency, unqualified staff, mishandling the animals.
We ended up going to ADI to fix a (life-threatening) problem that another nearby vet had caused.
We didn't plan to continue using ADI as our regular vet, because it's very pricey. But, then we saw how ADI is so professional, competent, transparent, and incredibly friendly -- not just with us, also with the animals. So we've been taking the cats to ADI ever since.

It's WORTH the money.

Highly recommend.

I've heard mixed reviews about ADI, mostly about the price, but when I took my cat there to test, I could understand why they put it that way. The doctor is very dedicated and highly professional. They are very calm and gentle with my cat. The receptionist was very nice (although one of the 2 of them had a rather bad attitude) But basically everything was perfect. I will still come back for the services and doctors there.

Had the pleasure of dealing with the staff and one of the doctors at Thao Dien online. the service and the details regarding the issue was explained very well. quite relieved after the chat, i will be bringing my dogs to the clinic for a thorough check up soon.

Animal Doctor International is modern, beautiful, comfortable and clean clinic. We spayed our cat Dana here, the operation was successful, Dr. Miguel is a very experienced surgeon.  The only thing is that the doctor could not put a collar on the cat and we could not do it ourselves at home, because our cat isn't simple:-) , so it was not easy for the first three days to protect her seam from licking.  On the third day we visited the clinic for a scheduled checkup and Dr. Martyna (this is our savior-angel) gave us a special medicine, we were able to put our Dana in special clothes, the seam was almost invisible and everything healed well.  Finally no incision is visible at all, Dr. Martyna consulted us several times by email, since we live in another city.  This is a manifestation of care and sincere kindness towards animals.  The clinic is very decent and popular, we have seen many clients who obviously visited this clinic not for the first time.  We want to wish the Animal Doctor International team all the best, success and prosperity. Best regards, Yuliia, Sergey, Dana

Living 12 years in Vietnam. This is by far most the best Veterinarian service here. Because there is love. There is care and there is professionalism and responsible people and doctors here. We sent 2 of our kids here for dental and medical check and were never ever worried one second and the kids health got so much better after their visit. We strongly recommend. If you love your kids. This is the place to go. Kudos to Doctor Martina and Doctor Tara. Update at September 2021 during the pandemic in HCMC: kudos to Doctor Nicolas to Ms Trang and all the team for the amazing support by calling us. By sending us medicine and by caring for our kids. We still strongly recommend. Update at September 2022: new place and better place. Best place ever for our kids.
The spa is amazing and the Doctors are the best.
A BIG THANK YOU to Doctor Martyna and Doctor Cassandra for treating Ruby. We strongly recommend 💞💝👍🌈🌟🙂
The staffs are all nice and love and care for our kids like babies. Our Ruby is so happy since then after being back home. 😘💕💞

data.formatted_address: 104/4 Khu Công Nghiệp Giang Điền, Giang Điền, Trảng Bom, Đồng Nai, Vietnam
data.name: Giang Dien Waterfall Eco Resort

reviews.text:
We loved our stay although it could have been better if they have rooms or tents for overnight stay.

Entrance was 100 for adults and 60 for children.

We came for 2 days, had to go out for the night, stayed in an inn, and back the following day. It is inconvenient for guests that they couldn't accommodate for this situation despite they are equipped with spaces and facilities to serve.

We were delighted that there were just a few people on the Friday when we arrived but it may be the cause for not having the bed spaces available.

All in all, we really enjoyed the place. The place is clean, the guards are watchful, the people around are helpful and friendly except for when I had to contest with the guard at the pool for telling us that it was already treated despite it was a Saturday and it was only yet 3pm. He eventually let us swim, clearly lying to us.
Quiet place today. I think they are not ready to invest this time. However , it is nice views.
Good picnic area and you can swim in the pool but I don't think it worth the pricey ticket (70k entry ticket)

Went with a couple of friends and I think we were literally the only people there as it was midweek. Luckily it has been raining for a while, so the waterfall was in full flow. Mosquitoes made us leave early sadly.
Good place to picnic, big park

data.formatted_address: PPF9+VCR, Khu đô thị Phú Mỹ Hưng, District 7, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
data.name: Starlight Bridge

reviews.text: It is a lightened bridge next to a small lake and a park. Not too special but nice at night.  Wouldn’t come here extra therefore but if you have plenty of time in HCMC or just are around it’s worth taking a look. In my eyes the park was pretty nice because it seemed like many local people came here to enjoy their free time.
Starlight bridge is one of the beautiful place in vietnam and it has big park. Fresh air and great view you can get it.
If you live in Phu My Hung you will likely end up here for your evening stroll. If you are under 20, it may even be compulsory. Quite a buzz at the weekend as younger folks strut their stuff.
Nice view of after sunset time. A beautiful view of department store walking areas.

Insta: iamcynditravel
Located just 20 minutes from the bustling city centre of Ho Chi Minh, Starlight Crescent Bridge is a must-visit destination for those seeking a peaceful getaway. This well-developed area features a scenic walkway with stunning lake views, a lovely park for relaxation, and a variety of restaurants serving delicious Vietnamese cuisine.

In addition to the serene daytime attractions, Starlight Crescent Bridge also offers a unique opportunity to experience local nightlife. Join the friendly locals as they socialize and unwind in this hidden gem. Sample the tasty street food and refreshing drinks from the many food carts dotted around the area.

data.formatted_address: Tổ 15, Ấp 5, Sông Trầu, Trảng Bom, Đồng Nai, Vietnam
data.name: Da Han waterfall

reviews.text: Da Han Waterfall is a beautiful and suitable place for your vacation or camping trip, because in the rainy season, the water here is not clear and a bit cloudy, but the view here is really very beautiful and fresh. With a ticket price of 70k / 1 person, 5k / 1 motorbike, it is really not too expensive for your tour, in addition, you are also given a glass of juice. The scenery is very majestic, fresh, the trees are green and cool, it feels like being immersed in nature when you come to visit this place.
Great place for medium to large size group or team, also suitables for picnic activities. Should prepare plenty of food and drinks beforhand.
The place is quite old, the time I visit was raining that’s why the water in the waterfalls is like Ca Phe Sue 🤣
Da Han waterfall is a great place to visit. Relaxing atmosphere and peaceful!

2 - 3 hours ride natural land scape from HoChiMinh city for Water Fall, Hill side escape the noise from big cities This is the right spot for nature Dong Nai Parks. Safe of Sound every thing shop close by.

data.formatted_address: 9WPC+7H5, Thạnh Thới, Long Hoà, Cần Giờ, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam
data.name: Beach April 30

reviews.text: Beach dirty and I don't recommend to swim. We had luch infront of this beach with lot of restaurants ready to cook for you the seafood. Not  expesinve.

This is like Nha Trang but more trash around and there aren't many people here. The reason why this beach is rated 1 star so much is the amount of TRASH on the beach. The first time I was here, I was astonished by the amount of trash. Now yeah, it is a lot more cleaner, but come on guys, don't leave your trash on the beach.

But hey, the seafood is great and the wind from the beach is really nice. Imagine sleeping on a hammock and you hear sounds of the waves clashing against the sand and winds from the beach flowing. Awesome, right?

Overall, swimming is really not recommended, but you can have a walk around the coastline - it is pretty nice especially when you get away from the entrance. Just go in a straight line until you reach the end of it, there is a little land covered with rocks, go there and enjoy the view. Also, the sand is cleaner than the entrance of the beach. In between the rocks, there are some little crabs, shells, snails, any a lot more. Feel free to take one of them - just don't take too much, it will damage the ecosystem.

7.5/10, because the city is pretty busy and noisy almost everywhere, so going here really change the atmosphere. Also bring some seafood here and enjoy the view, I guess.

And oh, go as early if you can. For no reason at all.
Not suitable for swimming but for sightseeing only
Nice beach but haven't way to go there, have to across the gate😆. Sea food around not really fresh, e bit expensive

Very close to Ho Chi Minh city and easy to get here. Its about 55 km from city center.  There are many buses at the ferry. The welcome gate so impresive and the flowers on both side of the street so beautiful but on the main street to the beach there is a big pile of rubbish waiting people come to collect it. I am so disappoited when I got here because the beach so dirty, a lot of rubbish around and there are no dusbin.
I think the official and the local people who leave in this place should clean the beach to attract more tourist.

data.formatted_address: Khu nghỉ mát Kỳ Nam, Phan Đức, Long Hoà, Cần Giờ, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam
data.name: Khu nghỉ mát Kỳ Nam

reviews.text: Big flat  beach, ideal for walking or playing, no good for swimming. Large wooded shady area with props for photographing your models.   Rooms are reasonably large with TV, fridge, air conditioning. Basic toiletries supplied.  There is a lift in the accommodation building.  Good getaway for the weekend, just over an hour from HCMC on a freeway. Meals and bar facilities available.  Has a large clean swimming pool and secure area for overnight storage of motor bikes.  700,000VnD includes breakfast.
Great weekend getaway from HCMC! friendly staff and great food!!
I have been here excellent service. Nice hotel. Nice food and nice location whose love vaction. Fresh seafood near by
Great place for vacation but can't swim here.
Ok

data.formatted_address: 41 Đ. Nguyễn Thị Minh Khai, Bến Nghé, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam

reviews.text: Good
Resort

data.formatted_address: Hồ Cốc, Ba Ria - Vung Tau, Vietnam
data.name: Hồ Cốc

reviews.text:
Mostly untouched area. One can definjt enjoy some quiet time here.
There are some camp spots as well.
We have been walking along the shoreline for 30 minutes and there was a constant stretch of plastic rubbish. Disgusting!
Went here at sunrise for a photography trip. Recommend go early if you want a quiet relax place.
The trip was so EXCITED! I was surprised about the landscape of 4 Seasons Beach! What a peacful and stunning scenry. Besides food price was reasonable and it was also fresh and delicous either.
Far from HCMC around 100km, located in Ba Ria Vung Tau, Ho Coc beach quite crowded but still a beautifull place to go at the weekend or holiday.
Come here with your friends to take a photo keep your youth

data.formatted_address: 1 Đ. Nguyễn Tất Thành, Phường 13, Quận 4, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam
data.name: Dragon Wharf - Ho Chi Minh Museum (HCMC Branch)

reviews.text:
Although this is a free museum, it still wasn't worth the trip. Calling it a museum is a bit of a stretch - it's more like a photo gallery memorial of Ho Chi Minh. It lacks engagement as all the walls are just plastered with photos and there's no clear timeline or storyline to follow. Honestly a disappointment as the reviews seemed very positive. Perhaps it's more popular with the locals who know the history already but as a tourist, I didn't learn anything interesting and just spent 30 minutes looking at photos and the few sparse status.

There is a great view which was the only redeeming quality.

Also, some reviews say they were charged money but we just walked straight in and no one stopped us, so just walk like you know where you're going or even go around the outside of the building first and enter from the side to avoid the entrance fee if you decide to go.

Note, there's no AC either, just some fans to keep the air moving but it was HOT. The walk there was even hotter, and not the best terrain.

It’d be a great trip ever!!! I had a assignment for presenting a historic figures and historical stuff!!! We planned on a trip to come here!!!
The place is so stunning and spacious!!! There are tons of rewarding stuff here, if you admire Vietnamese History, you must come here and observe by yourselves
If you haven't been here before, you can come here once, the scenery is nice.
HCMC Museum, not too big, but there are some interesting things and information. Ticket : 10.000 / person
Great quiet location even though it is just off the main road, some history and great information within these walls

data.formatted_address: 173 Long Thuận, Long Phước, Quận 9, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam
data.name: Long Island Castle

reviews.text: I was here 2 years ago but it's much nicer now. Cleaner and well maintained.
Nice place to take photo, movie making or a couples wanna have a great photo on their wedding album, but the entrance ticket is really expensive - RM 400 each
Good for photographer. but you need to prepare foods since the location is far from town and canteen is limited in menu.
Great place for pictures in a lovely landscape
Thanks for letting us bring the kids. Very beautiful place. I recommend exploring all the rooms. Don't forget to say hi to Donny

data.formatted_address: 799 Đ. Nguyễn Văn Linh, Tân Phú, Quận 7, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam
data.name: Saigon Exhibition and Convention Center (SECC)

reviews.text: It's a morden architecture, surrounded by office towers and luxury hotels. There is a packaging and processing industry expo in the two exhibition halls (Hall A & B) of SECC. Hall C is a big camp outside of the main building.
Big venue for event organizing. They have many hall which specialises for each style of events.
That occasion is really special. Food and hotel exhibition 2024 is so big and great.
They have a busy agenda in the year . Most of events were sufficent for visitors except some were quite monotonous

A decent size exhibition hall situated at the center of district 7 that has the capacity to hold multiple events at the same time. The Retail Franchise and Coffee Expo Vietnam 2024 was held here and the organization was as good as it could get.

data.formatted_address: Hẻm 58 Phạm Ngọc Thạch, Phường 6, Quận 3, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam
data.name: The Nutshell

reviews.text: Awesome place, the staff is friendly and helpful. So many unique and creative items to pick, brilliant for presents. Highly recommend and encourage you to support them.

Located in a not-so-easy to find alley, still if you find this local Vietnamese youth's creative store, you'll be surprised by their casual creativity.  Don't hesitate to support them by buying souvenirs.
I will be hosting a bi weekly event here from this Sunday for an art event.. the Cactus room is on the top floor with lots of natural light . Seems perfect for an art event
Very unique place to shop. Buy some local art craft. Wonderful!

I went because my partner really wanted to go.
It was amazing that there were a lot of cute props.
There were many people who liked cute props and stationery.
The price is outrageous. I don’t think it’s much different from Korea.

data.formatted_address: 4 Phạm Ngọc Thạch, Bến Nghé, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh 700000, Vietnam

reviews.text:
This is an ideal destination for teenagers in Ho Chi Minh City to meet, socialize, connect, experience, and learn. True to its name, this place regularly hosts activities and events tailored for the youth, students. It's a place worth visiting for all age groups, especially the youth.
💳Ticket fee: free entry
☕Coffee shop: yes, there is a nice coffee store✅
🍰Food&Drink: there are a lot of store with street concept
🥁There is a weekend market with night market concept. You can buy beautiful clothes, jewelry and gifts here.
🎻Event: here, there are so many activities and events, especially on weekends, such as cultural and artistic performances, book fairs, music shows,...
📝Education: there are also many course like Soft skills, yoga, dance, martial arts,...
🎯There is an Archery Club
👮‍♀️Security: this place has guards. They are always ready to help you.
🛵Parking: yes✅
🧻WC: clean and comfortable
🛤Near: Nguyen Van Binh book street, Diamond Plaza and American Center, Hồ Con Rùa,...

- Good: In the city centre, very near with the Diamond Department Store. Have the open space, big yard and souvenir store inside. Parking fee is very cheap (only VND3000).
- Bad: not easy to look a parking lot, if you came late, must parked in the inside parking (with motorcycle) and uneasy because it's have the very high ramp. One more point is usually stuck when left because it's in the main street.
- I just came for the Origami Exhibition, so I only take the photo of origami.

I spent my youth here quite a lot. They hold fairs nearly every week. The atmosphere of crowding specializes a nightless Sai Gon.

This centre offers a lot of activities for young people. In weekend there are free music show by students.
Full of cheap but good quality clothes shop and souvenir shop, worth to have a walk

data.name: Saigon railway station

reviews.text: Clean and easy to nevigate . We took train SE12 from saigon to Tuy Hoa and enjoyed the service. Very clean coaches and facilities upto mark. Train started on time.
Saigon Railway Station is located at 308/43 Cách Mạng Tháng 8 street, ward 10, ward 9 district 3, HCMC
Overall good. Booked vietnam rail 4 sleeper danang to hcm. Had 50k rice combo since didn't brought anything onboard dinner. Toilet still stinky so you need to go adjacent car to check it out.

I personally couldn't travel on these trains again in my lifetime. They seem to be more for the locals, as it's the cheapest way to travel throughout the country. Did 17hrs from HCMC to Da Nang, and at the end I felt like my head was still moving, as well as such a lack of sleep. Had a family on one bed in the cabin at one point, and people are very loud even at late hours. The pillows were full of mold and bacteria, a massive health hazard. Lucky I bought my neck pillow and used that. They let people smoke wherever on the train and they smoked right where the air-conditioning vents are, so plumes of cigarette smoke seeped into the cabins periodically throughout the ENTIRE trip. It blocked my nose and made my sinuses and head sick by the end of the trip. Very bad and a massive health concern for healthy passengers. The service was mostly unfriendly, and seemed somewhat racist towards foreigners, as well. One lady worker shooed me away for trying to ask something, very stupid and ignorant women. The toilets were 3rd world filthy as they are not maintained and had no supply of toilet paper. Maybe if that women used her bad energy towards cleaning, the trains might be somewhat comfortable. Imo, for 60AUD one way, it was still way too expensive for the quality and service received. I got a refund for the return leg through the travel agency I booked through, and bought a ticket on Vietnam Airlines, and was very glad I did. These people have NO health standards and are very lazy. Paying this amount of money for this level of service and cleanliness, is just not acceptable. You would be shut down immediately if you charged even 1 dollar in Australia for this service. It doesn't take much to fix these problems, but the apathy is rife, unfortunately. Do better.

First class is outdated and dirty. Staff think it's a good idea to play tictoks on their phone at full volume at 6am outside the first class sleeping berths when everyone is trying to sleep, you'd think common sense would prevail but evidently not. Rats in the cabin too.

data.formatted_address: 1 Đ. Nguyễn Thông, Phường 6, Quận 3, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam
data.name: GA SÀI GÒN - CỔNG CHÍNH

reviews.text: Stop by the station to buy our train ticket to Nha Trang. The gentleman who assisted us was friendly and helpful. Prices are significantly cheaper at the station compared to elsewhere. No ID is required, only your name and date of birth. You can choose between a bed or a chair. There's a senior discount available for Vietnamese citizens. The train food options are excellent and regularly available. The journey to Nha Trang offers breathtaking scenery, making it one of the best ways to experience the country.
Vietnam railroad tranportation experience is acceptable, just not expecy too much. If you want to try to experience it should be alright.

The railway station of Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam.

I'm surprised to see such clean railway station. One can even walk in barefoot there like so clean 🥺

Apart from that, the ticket booking facility is also very convenient. Loved everything there. We boarded Saigon-Danang train from there.

GA SÀI GÒN, the central railway station of Ho Chi Minh City, impresses with its well-maintained infrastructure and efficient operations. It is advisable to arrive at the station at least 30 minutes before your scheduled departure to ensure a smooth boarding process. During my journey to Tuy Hoa, the train departed precisely at the time mentioned, reflecting the punctuality of the services. The station's cleanliness and organization contribute to a positive travel experience. Whether you are a local commuter or a tourist exploring Vietnam by rail, GA SÀI GÒN serves as a reliable gateway to various destinations.

A so little and quiet train place for a so big city, its really amazing. You have many shops and restaurants there. Better to buy some banh mi for these long and interesting travel. Welcome in these long beautiful train travel adventure.
